Instructions & Guidelines to create the database schema in mysql that
satisfies following conditions:
● Design and create tables with suitable columns, data types and normalisation.
Ensure appropriate relationships, such as one-to-one, one-to-many, and
many-to-many, are maintained. If necessary, create additional tables.
● Implement reference tables with relevant values for the dependent fields (shown
in yellow).
● Incorporate indexes on columns that are frequently used in search or join
operations. Identify the columns that are commonly queried or involved in joins,
and create indexes to optimise query performance.
● Utilize triggers, procedures, views and functions where necessary to enhance
functionality and maintain scalability. Document these database objects, including
their purpose, input parameters, and expected output.
● Develop and implement a logging mechanism to track and record changes made
to candidate records.
● Share .sql dump file while submitting the assignment. (mandatory)
Assignment Tasks:
Task 1:
a. Document the logging mechanism, including the structure of the log
table, the logged events and the information captured in the logs.
b. Create comprehensive documentation for the database schema,
including table definitions, column descriptions, relationships, and
indexes. Document any naming conventions, data constraints, and
data types used throughout the schema.
c. Document any specific design decisions, such as the reasoning
behind the choice of normalisation levels, table structures and
relationships.
(Note : You need to write the documentation along with queries, tables etc. for a, b & c to
get maximum scores)
Task 2:
a. Write a query to delete the User record.(Mandatory)
b. Write a query to search candidates based on name, email and
linkedIn URLs.
c. Write an optimized boolean search query to fetch candidate
records using resumetext.
d. Write a query to fetch comma separated User IDs against each
account title.
e. Write a query to fetch counts of Candidates, based on gender, on
each account.

What should I do and get a grade7 based on this criteria: EDUC7009: Career Guidance – Counselling for Life Planning
Assessment 2: Rationale for Career 
Development Service- task sheet
Length:
3,000 words
Weighting: 60% Due date: Friday 20 October 2023 
at 2p.m. (submitted via Turnitin)
Learning Objectives: 
1. Understand the theory informing career development work 
3. Develop and implement client appropriate interventions such as career education, career programs, career 
counselling, and career assessment 
4. Critically evaluate career development resources 
5. Articulate a personal practice framework for career development work 
6. Demonstrate ethical practice and professional conduct in career development work
Description:
Develop a discussion paper for a school or organisation that provides a rationale for the development and provision 
of a career development service for a particular student/client/employee population. Examples of such a service 
include career development programs or career counselling, underpinned by career theory.
1. Describe the context of your organisation and the intended recipients of your service (i.e. students, clients, 
employees).
2. Explain the career development needs of your intended recipients and describe evidence of those needs. Use 
relevant literature and career theory to support your explanation of the intended recipients' career development 
needs.
3. Develop a rationale for the provision of a career development service for the recipients you have identified.
4. In your paper, describe the benefits and challenges of the development and provision of your proposed career 
development service for the recipients and also other students/staff/administration/management.
5. Use significant Australian and international literature, career theory, reports and policy to support your paper. Your 
reference list should contain at least 20 references including books, book chapters and journal articles. You must 
use APA 7
th edition referencing.
Submitting your work via Turnitin
Assignments for this course will be submitted electronically via Blackboard and using Turnitin. Before submitting any 
assignments for this course, you must ensure you have completed UQ's compulsory online Academic Integrity 
Tutorial. The module can be found at: https://www.uq.edu.au/integrity
In uploading an assignment via Turnitin you are certifying that it is your original work, that it has not been copied in 
whole or part from another person or source except where this is properly acknowledged, and that it has not in whole 
or part been previously submitted for assessment in any other course at this or any other university. In some cases, 
resubmission may be part of the requirements for the course assessment.
When you successfully submit your assessment to Turnitin you should receive a confirmation page as a digital 
receipt. You will receive this information via your student e-mail account. If you do not receive a submission ID you 
should regard your submission as unsuccessful.
Advice and guidance: 
Format/Structure: 
• Follow the marking grid/criteria sheet/rubric to ensure you include all necessary parts of the paper. 
• Use sub-headings to make your paper easy to follow. 
• Assignments must adhere to the word length. Any text written after the 3000 (plus 10%) word limit will not be read 
by the marker. 
Very good attempts: 
• Demonstrate an excellent understanding of evidence-based career development programs. 
• Most likely be a result of wide reading and a clear rationale for the service they are proposing. 
• Contain clear and concise writing and have been thoroughly proof-read, such that spelling and grammar errors 
have been removed. 
• Strict adherence to APA style
Important note: 
• Your report must be uploaded to Blackboard using Turnitin by 2pm on Friday 20 October 2023
The following applies to all assessments in this course: 
Use of generative AI to support or inform assessment.
Artificial Intelligence (AI) provides emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. 
Students may appropriately use AI in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI 
in each instance. 
A failure to reference AI use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
Further support: 
Please refer to forum in the Assessment folder in Blackboard. If you require further support, email the course coordinator to
arrange a Zoom meeting to discuss your questions.

Write a lengthy writing prompt describing these conditions in rich detail: This story is written in person, present tense. You are Dean. You are on a work-related vacation to Japan with your rival, Akura. You are renting a traditonal Japanese residence. You and Akura frequently bicker, banter, and argue. To the unobservant, it would appear that you utterly despise each other. You’re constantly annoyed by each other’s presence and rarely agree on anything. However, there’s something oddly enjoyable about the back-and-forth routine between you to. One night, as both you and her are exhausted from traveling all day, you accidentally end up snuggling together for but a minute before coming back to your senses and push each other away, incredibly embarassed. Between the two of you, Akura is the more witty, playful, and sarcastic one, while you’re more composed but defensive.


You drag your suitcase behind you, its wheels clacking on the wooden floor. The traditional Japanese residence surrounds you with its calming atmosphere, even in the dreary weather. The soothing scent of fresh tatami mats and the soft light filtering through shoji screens offer a sense of order, although you can’t forget the tension between you and Akura during the journey.

“I still can’t believe you got us lost in that ancient village, Dean,” Akura says, rolling her eyes and dropping her suitcase onto the floor with a thud. She kicks off her shoes and lets out a huff, not as impressed by the surroundings as you are. “Have you never heard of a GPS?”
“It’s not my fault the GPS couldn’t recognize the old streets,” you reply, feeling yourself get defensive before taking a deep breath and grounding yourself. You try to focus on the peacefulness of the room, hoping it’ll calm Akura down too.

“Well, we’re here now, aren’t we?” you say, attempting diplomacy as you start to unpack.
Akura glares at the two separate futons on the floor, placed far apart from each other. “It doesn’t change the fact that it took us far longer than necessary to get here.” She pokes your chest playfully.

Not wanting to argue, you swallow your retort and instead focus on settling in. The interior of the residence is stunning, with simple decorations that add a touch of elegance - scrolls on the walls, a low table with short-legged chairs, and a subtle scent of green tea that fills the air.

Later, after dinner, you both head back to the residence. The rain outside has intensified, and any lingering tension between you and Akura seems to have come indoors.

“You know,” she says, a sly smile on her face. “You have great dinner etiquitte. Too bad

Write about a postgraduate-level reflexive writing essay that requires you to critically analyse the changes to your own understanding of leadership identity and leadership identity construction. This critical inquiry will culminate in a reflexive statement about your own understanding of leadership identity construction that highlights how this shapes your own leadership practice and identity.

Here is the suggested structure for the essay.
Introduction (around 300 words): briefly outline your leadership experience and leadership identity (with links to literature) and an overview of essay intent and structure. Start with a motivational quote from any scholarly literature listed below about introversion in leadership  that summarizes the entire content of the essay. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can. Output should be around 300 words.
Initial understanding of leadership and leadership identity (around 1000 words): Outline your initial understanding of leadership and leadership identity and analyse what contributed to this existing understanding. Use evidence from your reflective journal and the relevant literature to support this discussion. Prior to beginning the unit EUN656 (Leadership Identity), my view of leadership was limited to the notion that it is any role from the organizational structure within my institution and it was a formally assigned role by the administrators that have supervisory and management roles. I was tasked to be the head of the Management Information Systems (MIS) Team for a year. The MIS Team is primarily composed of people who are much older than me and holds much higher teaching positions than me. I consider myself to be a purpose-driven servant leader who believed that if I could efficiently carry out my duties and responsibilities for the MIS team on a day-to-day basis, I would be an effective teacher leader for the team. Moreover, I consider myself to be an introverted teacher leader, thus, I thought that it limited me to become an effective teacher leader due to my shyness and awkwardness to socially interact with my team members, especially that I am the youngest person in the team and I am the lowest in terms of position and years of service in my institution. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can. Output should be around 1000 words.
Key point of Cognitive Dissonance (around 1400 words): Discuss and analyse one of your bigger points of cognitive dissonance. What was one of the bigger ideas about introversion in leadership that challenged your initial understanding? Use evidence from relevant literature to support this discussion. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can.  Output should be around 1400 words.
Critical Element 1 (around 900 words): Identify first critical element of leadership and leadership identity where your understanding has shifted dramatically over the unit. Critically analyse the various changes and use evidence from relevant literature to support this analysis. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can.  Output should be around 900 words.
Critical Element 2 (around 900 words): Identify second critical element of leadership and leadership identity where your understanding has shifted dramatically over the unit. Critically analyse the various changes and use evidence from relevant literature to support this analysis. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can.  Output should be around 900 words.
Critical Element 3 (around 900 words): Identify third critical element of leadership and leadership identity where your understanding has shifted dramatically over the unit. Critically analyse the various changes and use evidence from relevant literature to support this analysis. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can.  Output should be around 900 words.
Summary/Reflexive Overview (around 600 words): To summarise your learning journey, present a reflexive overview that traces the key changes in your understanding and ideas about leadership and leadership identity. You are required to use as much scholarly literature as you can so that you can further substantiate your claims. Provide all necessary in-text citations as often as you can.  Output should be around 600 words.

- “A History of Leadership” by Keith Grint, from The SAGE Handbook of Leadership, edited by Alan Bryman, et al., SAGE Publications

Settings:

Character Profile: Yaqdea Levi

Age: 13

Physical Appearance:

Yaqdea has the typical features of albinism, which includes very pale, almost translucent skin and colorless hair. Her hair falls in soft waves to her shoulders, framing her delicate, heart-shaped face. Her eyes, though visually impaired, are a striking pale blue with a crimson red glow when she uses her Black Lantern powers.

Origin: Riverside, a small close-knit community

Powers and Abilities:

As a Black Lantern, Yaqdea has unique abilities powered by the black ring bestowed upon her by Nekron, the Lord of the Unliving.

1. Necromancy: Yaqdea can summon and communicate with the souls of the deceased. She can also control and bind the spirits to do her bidding.

2. Dark Energy Constructs: The black ring allows Yaqdea to harness dark energy and create constructs, objects, or weapons of her choosing. The strength of her constructs is equal to her will and her understanding of the materials being manipulated.

3. Darkness Manipulation: Yaqdea can control and manipulate shadows and darkness. This ability allows her to create small areas of darkness, become one with the shadows, and use them for stealth and reconnaissance purposes.

4. Flight: The black ring bestows Yaqdea the power of flight, enabling her to defy gravity and soar through the skies. This enables her to travel quickly and effortlessly.

5. Regeneration: Yaqdea’s connection to the ring allows her to heal faster than an ordinary human, regenerating from injuries that would otherwise prove fatal.

6. Enhanced Strength and Stamina: Yaqdea’s reanimated form possesses strength and endurance greater than any living human. This makes her formidable in hand-to-hand combat and other physical challenges.

7. Energy Absorption: Yaqdea can absorb energy and life force from her surroundings, which she can then utilize to power her abilities or release as destructive energy bursts.

Weaknesses:

1. Memory Loss: Yaqdea’s resurrection as a Black Lantern has resulted in the loss of most of her memories from her past life. She struggles to piece together who she once was, leaving her vulnerable to manipulation or deception.

2. Limited Control: Yaqdea’s newfound powers may overwhelm her at times, causing her to lose control or unintentionally unleash destructive energy.

3. Emotional Vulnerability: Due to her tragic past, Yaqdea is susceptible to strong emotional pain, guilt, and loneliness. These emotions can weaken her powers, as well as make it difficult for her to remain focused and in control.

4. Light Sensitivity: As a Black Lantern whose power revolves around darkness, Yaqdea is sensitive to bright light. This makes her vulnerable in well-lit areas or when exposed to light-based abilities.

Goals: Yaqdea seeks to regain her lost memories and uncover the truth about her tragic death. Along the way, she strives to bring justice to those responsible for the violent school shooting that ended her human life, and to find a place where she truly belongs.

Moral Compass: Yaqdea’s moral compass is primarily good, but her journey as a Black Lantern will continuously test her resolve. As she learns about the darkness within herself and the world around, she must find a way to keep her moral compass intact, and not succumb to corruption.


Chapter 1: The Day the Skies Turned Red

Yaqdea Levi had never quite felt at home in her own skin. Her unusual appearance wasn’t the only thing that made her different, and perhaps set her apart from the others. With colors a mere myth, the wide world of black, white, and grey was all the thirteen-year-old guest of Albinism knew. Born and raised in the small, close-knit community of Riverside, Yaqdea quickly learned that the world had nothing to offer to a girl such as herself except harsh glares and callous whispers.

Every day passed with the knowledge that she was different. Every day was spent hiding from herself, just as the sun hid behind a blanket of clouds. She was the moon hiding behind the shade. She was the figure who seemed to float along, visible amid the shadows. She was Yaqdea Levi, the seemingly ethereal, often tormented girl from Riverside. And then, one day, everything changed.

It began as the most ordinary of days, a soft haze hugging the town while Yaqdea walked to her school. The vibrant autumn colors that engulfed Riverside High were unseen by her eyes; to her, the landscape was a continuous metamorphosis of dissolving shades of grey.

Upon arrival, Yaqdea took her usual place at the back of her first class of the day. Although she felt the stares of her classmates, she’d grown accustomed to blending in with the background, hiding behind the curtain of her shoulder-length white hair. She immersed herself in the monotony of the day, trying to forget that she wasn’t quite complete.

Just as the sun lazily hid behind the clouds, Yaqdea couldn’t shake the feeling that something was brimming beneath the veneer. The energy was off within the walls of the school, and as the day passed slowly, she couldn’t quite grasp why she felt like her world was unraveling. She felt a chill run down her spine, making her shiver involuntarily.

During the lunch break, Yaqdea sat alone in her sheltered spot underneath the bleachers, seeking refuge from the whispers and pain. She clung to her secret sanctuary, finding solace in the solitude as she munched quietly on her sandwich. The humming undercurrent of students’ voices filled her ears, mumbling together into a disquieting lullaby.

It wasn’t until her final class that the unease she’d felt all day reached a terrifying crescendo. The clock had just struck two, when Yaqdea’s life changed forever. The once established peace of Riverside was shattered along with the windows that blew in around the students. A heart-stopping explosion, followed by screams of fear punctured the air, as chaos erupted like a volcano, spewing ash and terror upon everyone inside.

In an instant, her classmates became fixtures of terror—screaming, crying, scrambling for safety. Yaqdea’s heart hammered against her chest, like a trapped bird futilely attempting to escape. Her legs carried her across the debris-ridden floor, instinct guiding her towards the door.

But fate, cruel and unforgiving, had already sealed her destiny. The sky above turned a sinister crimson, like the blood that was rapidly staining the hallway. As a bullet pierced the fragile barrier of her skin, Yaqdea found herself floating above her body, witnessing her own end, but feeling no pain.

The world she had never quite belonged to began to fade away. Her heart, once panicked and thundering, ceased to beat. Yaqdea fell into darkness, enveloped by nature’s darkest hue. As her life bled out, so too did the last of the meager hope that once resided in her heart.

But inside this void of oblivion, Yaqdea’s desperate soul began to pulsate to the rhythm of an ancient force. Her unquenched desire to live—to one day belong—echoed through the realms beyond life itself. And as the girl that had been confined to a monochromatic existence began slipping through the cracks of existence, an ancient force was waiting to catch her.

Drawn by the unique energy of her soul and the unsatisfied lust for life, Nekron, the Lord of the Unliving, looked upon Yaqdea with interest. He considered the broken girl, her spirit drifting like a lost feather on the winds of the underworld. The great harbinger of death approached her with a peculiar offering―his mark of rebirth, the Black Lantern ring.

“If you accept this ring,” Nekron intoned, black flames flickering ominously around him, “you will return to the living realm, reborn as a Black Lantern. You will have a chance to live again, but not as you did before.”

Yaqdea, clinging to the edge of oblivion, hesitated for a moment. She knew that accepting this offer might tarnish her very soul, but her deep-rooted fear of the unknown trumped any other misgivings.

With a silent, determined nod, she slipped the ring on her ethereal finger. As the macabre power enshrouded her spirit, her once mundane world suddenly exploded into existence. For the first time, Yaqdea Levi would bear witness to what awaited beyond the shades of grey.


Chapter 2: A Haunting Rebirth

Surrounded by cold steel cabinets and the overwhelming stench of chemical preservatives, Yaqdea awoke with a gasp. Her eyes darted around the sterile chamber as she grasped for memories that no longer belonged to her. The faint sound of beeping machines and the rustle of her own shallow breaths filled the air.

She pulled herself out of the body bag with trembling hands, her fingertips brushing against the cool metal of a morgue drawer. Confusion twisted her mind as she tried to recall how she had arrived here. A strange tingling sensation crawling across her skin startled her, drawing her gaze to the black ring encircling her finger—the ring that she didn’t remember acquiring.

Yaqdea’s fingertips danced along her temples, trying to coax her past memories from their hiding places within her mind. But her effort failed, her thoughts revealing nothing more than an abysmal void. Absently, she tore at the bloodstained remnants of her school uniform, the chilling sense of dread leaving her shaken.

Before she could succumb to the kaleidoscope of emotions, Yaqdea focused on the only link to her past life that remained: the black ring from Nekron upon her finger. She hesitated for a moment, then pulled at it, but it remained bound to her, as if fused to her very being. A surge of energy emanated from the ring, pulsing through her body as she registered the vast power surging through it.

Taking a deep breath, Yaqdea whispered to the ring—a plea for clarity, a beckoning for answers she could no longer reach within herself.

“Please… help me remember.”

The faintest flicker of a voice whispered in her mind, “Fear not the unknown, for it shall be revealed in due time. Embrace the darkness, as life blossoms from its depths.”

With no memory to guide her, Yaqdea’s instincts propelled her to stand on trembling legs and push through the ominous darkness of the morgue. Glimmering streaks of moonlight from the partly drawn curtains guided her way toward the door. Unbeknownst to her, she was on a path that would forever change her existence and the world she had left behind.

As she stumbled through the dim hallway, she finally found an exit that led her outside. A cool, gentle breeze brushed her pale, unnaturally cold skin as she stepped into a world equally foreign and hauntingly familiar. She paused for a moment, buffeted by a mix of warming emotions; faint fragments of her past life teased her mind, though not quite breaking through the dark veil of her present.

The moon’s ethereal glow washed over her as she held up her hand with the black ring, her eyes drawn to its unnerving allure. With cautious certainty, Yaqdea began to understand the choice she had made and the power it granted her.

The town she had once known now became her canvas, mottled with forgotten memories and freshly blooming life. The hidden knowledge of her newfound power would soon be revealed, as the girl with ghost-white skin and a ravenous hunger for life took her first steps into the world as a Black Lantern.

Yaqdea had much to learn, and the unfathomable depths of darkness held secrets that would soon be unlocked. But for now, her focus rested on the journey ahead—a haunting crusade to restore not only her memory but also eventually bring justice to those who robbed her of life in the first place. Tonight marked the rebirth of Yaqdea Levi, the misplaced spirit from Riverside, who would now walk the world as a harbinger of darkness—a Black Lantern.


Chapter 3: The Empty Coffin

The sun hid behind unyielding clouds, casting a solemn gray hue over the cemetery. Families and friends gathered in droves, their hearts heavy as they mourned the innocent lives lost in the senseless school shooting. The air was thick with grief, as the once vibrant lives of the children were rendered to nothing more than fading memories.

Among the rows of closed caskets, one stood out—withdrawn from the rest but no less painful. A beautifully framed picture of Yaqdea adorned the polished wood, her pale features almost ethereal in the soft light.

Whispers of confusion and concern filled the air, tales of Yaqdea’s missing body now a morbid mystery amongst the townsfolk. Despite the tragedy surrounding them, Yaqdea’s family huddled together, their shared secret lingering heavily in their tormented hearts.

Yaqdea’s twin brother, Issac, stood at a distance, gazing at the empty coffin with unfathomable sadness etched upon his face. As he clung to his family, an unsettling thought gnawed at the edges of his mind. Amidst the darkness of the tragedy, he couldn’t shake the feeling that his sister was not truly gone—that she was hidden, waiting to be found again in some obscure corner of their world.

In the days that followed, Issac began his secretive search, driven by the unwavering conviction that his sister’s essence still lingered. The whispers of the missing body fueled his determination, even when doubt threatened to consume him. As the town of Riverside continued to grieve and the mystery surrounding Yaqdea seemingly faded into the background, Issac’s resolve to uncover the truth intensified.

And unbeknownst to Isaac and their shattered family, Yaqdea had indeed returned but not in the way any of them could have imagined. Even as they clung to the remnants of her memory, Yaqdea Levi navigated the dark shadows of her newfound existence, venturing down a path that would only distance her further from the loving embrace of her family.

As the days stretched into weeks, and the leaves began to fall from their perches, changing the world around them into an eerie reflection of the sorrow that enveloped Riverside, both Yaqdea and Issac set forth on their respective journeys—each driven by an unyielding quest for truth and an overwhelming love that bound them through all the darkness that they faced.

The world had changed for the Levi family, who now clung to the hope that their lives could be restored, even if it meant embracing a future marred by the haunting specter of their past. For Yaqdea, her journey as a Black Lantern had only just begun, and her newfound powers would take her to places she never imagined possible.

And while their paths were no longer intertwined, the bond between Yaqdea and her twin brother Issac would remain an unstoppable force that defied the barriers of life and death. In their love, they found strength, and in their unwavering determination to find each other once again, they discovered the true meaning of family.

With Yaqdea’s past a fading mirage and her destiny now as a harbinger of darkness, the world was a vaster, more dangerous place than ever before. But through it all, one thing remained clear: the love they held for each other would never fade, as they traversed through life on their haunting, separate paths. Only time would tell what fate had in store for the girl who walked the world as both a revenant and a beacon of hope.

For in the furthest reaches of the cosmos, in the deepest recesses of their shattered hearts, their tale was far from over. And where darkness reigned supreme, the light of hope burned eternal. The journey of Yaqdea Levi and her twin brother Issac was only just beginning…

expand to the max while keeping all citations and references. Find sources of citations in Havard style at the end: 7.6 Challenges in Christian Leadership: Embracing the Cross
In modern Africa, the landscape of leadership has evolved significantly, marked by a diversity of cultures, a separation of traditional and administrative systems, and a shift towards democratic governance. Unlike the historical autocratic rule of kings, contemporary leaders must navigate the complexities of a varied society with distinct cultural values, diverse ways of acting, and a clear separation between spiritual, political, public, and private realms. The challenge arises when leaders govern with assumptions rooted in pre-colonial models, as the dynamics of societies have transformed, requiring adaptive and inclusive leadership approaches.
Serving the Lord is undoubtedly a glorious privilege, a divine calling that carries with it the profound honor of bearing the cross with Jesus. As Christ stated, “If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.” However, the reality is that every cross is uniquely shaped, much like the running lanes of a race marked out differently for each individual. The race set before us may not align with our preferences and is undoubtedly distinct from others, yet it is intricately designed by God for His glory and our ultimate good. In preparing for the noble role of Christian leadership, it is imperative not to embark on this journey in ignorance but with a profound understanding of the challenges that lie ahead.
To glean insights into the challenges faced by Christian leaders, we turn to the firsthand experiences of those who have walked the path of ministry. Each leader was posed with the question: “Describe one or more problems (challenges) you have faced in the ministry that have caused you personal pain.” Here are their candid responses:
1. Spiritual Warfare and Opposition: Leader’s Response: “One of the profound challenges I encountered was the relentless spiritual warfare and opposition that accompanied my ministry. It was a deep, personal pain to witness the forces working against the Kingdom’s advancement. The attacks on my faith, integrity, and the very essence of the message I sought to convey were emotionally taxing.”
2. Navigating Disunity and Conflict: Leader’s Response: “In my leadership journey, the painful challenge of dealing with disunity and conflict within the congregation surfaced. Witnessing divisions among the flock, navigating through misunderstandings, and attempting to reconcile conflicting perspectives brought personal anguish. Leading people towards unity while staying true to the gospel’s core became a challenging tightrope to walk.”
3. Facing Criticism and Misunderstanding: Leader’s Response: “One challenge that caused personal pain was the constant criticism and misunderstanding from both within and outside the church. The weight of being judged, sometimes unfairly, for decisions made and actions taken in accordance with God’s leading was emotionally taxing. Maintaining resilience amid the relentless scrutiny was a demanding aspect of my journey.”
4. Balancing Ministry and Personal Sacrifice: Leader’s Response: “The challenge of striking a balance between the demands of ministry and personal sacrifice was personally painful. There were moments when the weight of responsibilities overshadowed personal well-being and family time. Navigating the tension between being fully present in the ministry and nurturing personal relationships required intentional effort and often came at a cost.”
5. Adapting to Changing Ministry Dynamics: Leader’s Response: “The evolving dynamics of ministry presented a significant challenge. Adapting to changing cultural, technological, and societal landscapes while staying true to biblical principles was a constant source of personal strain. Embracing innovation and transformation without compromising the timeless truth of the Gospel demanded both spiritual discernment and personal growth.”
In acknowledging and understanding these challenges, aspiring Christian leaders gain valuable insights into the complex realities of ministry. Embracing the cross in leadership means not only recognizing the pain that may arise but also seeking God’s strength and wisdom to navigate through these challenges with faith, resilience, and a deep commitment to His purposes.

Write an academic, scholarly review of this paper. The review should be harsh, but fair, and you should act like a journalism and communications researcher, raising accurate points about methods and theory. This is like the review for a peer-reviewed journal. I will first give you part 1 of the paper, acknowledge it and wait for parts 2-5 to write your review.

Part 1:

Executive summary

This research project was designed to help three nascent news and information outlets better understand the information needs of their communities. The three outlets were chosen in part because they were all grantees of the New Jersey Civic Information Consortium – a first-in-the-nation public funding initiative begun in 2018.
 
The research included an online survey asking community members questions about how they find local news and information, what kinds of topics they are most interested in, and their general feelings about their towns. In one community – Paterson – the survey was distributed in four languages (English, Spanish, Arabic, and Bengali), to reach as many members of this diverse population as possible. In each town we also convened at least two focus groups, where community members gathered in-person (with one exception) to share their thoughts and conversation with a professional facilitator, who used roughly the same questions as those asked in the survey; however, the focus groups allowed for interaction and a more nuanced picture of the information landscape.

While the three communities we worked with – Paterson, Trenton, and Blairstown, NJ – differ in important ways, there are also commonalities in terms of people’s desires for local news and information. 

First, all three communities expressed a desire for some form of “service journalism,” whether it was in the form of more information about the location and content of municipal government meetings, how to find service providers, or contact information for local leaders. Content like this may seem like low-hanging fruit, but publishers who can keep up-to-date and reliable lists like this – all in one place – would provide tangible benefit to their communities. 

Second, we learned that people in all three communities rely heavily on Facebook for news and information about their towns and the people in them. While not everyone enjoys the often partisan or misleading information that circulates so easily on Facebook, it is still one of the first to be updated when news breaks and one of the best places for publishers to be highly visible. 

Finally, in two of the three communities – Paterson and Trenton – people want more local news about crime and safety, and in two others – Paterson and Blairstown – the publishers may grow their audience if they offer their content in languages other than English. In all three, at least some people mentioned wanting more feel-good, solutions-oriented local news.

After conducting the information needs assessments in each of the three towns, the publishers we worked with were given reports detailing and summarizing the feedback from their communities, along with recommendations for changes to their product to make it more responsive to those information needs. All three publishers are now in the process of making those improvements, armed with a clearer idea of the kinds of news and information their audience desires.
Introduction: Why information needs assessments?

The idea of a journalist looking to an audience for guidance on the most newsworthy topics of the day – rather than to an editor or by relying on amorphous news values – is relatively new. This practice gained prominence in the mid-2010s with the formation of several organizations to help newsrooms more easily understand the information needs and wants of their audiences. For example The Listening Post Collective (est. 2013), Groundsource (est. 2015), Hearken (est. 2015), and Outlier Media (est. 2016) all help news and community organizations contact people directly to gather information about what they want and need to know. Internews has been conducting information needs assessments in conflict zones and with other communities facing adversity for more than 10 years (Internews, 2023). Crittenden and Haywood (2020) date this movement to the Knight Commission’s 2009 report, “Informing Communities: Sustaining Democracy in the Digital Age” which was closely followed in by Waldman’s (2011) FCC report, “The Information Needs of Communities: The changing media landscape in a broadband age,” the title of which heralded the turn toward the audience.

In some ways, an information needs assessment is as simple and straightforward as the term implies: one seeks to understand what information a community needs. But of course, it is more involved than this. Sarah Alvarez of Outlier Media offers one definition: “Information [needs] are not just what people don’t know; it is information people need but there is a barrier to accessing, understanding, or trusting the information.” (Alvarez, 2021). Information needs assessments in the context of journalism imply “a more interactive – and potentially reciprocal” relationship with the audience, reflecting the practice’s close affinity to engaged journalism, which in turn grew out of the public journalism movement of the 1990s (Schmidt and Lawrence, 2020, p. 518-519). Information needs assessments stop short of making the audience co-creators of content, however; assessments such as those conducted here are in this way perhaps closer to audience research than engaged journalism (for a study that bridges the two, see McCullough and DeVigal, 2022).

Building on Alvarez, an information needs assessment might ask, what are the barriers to accessing information in a given community? Do people have access to broadband internet; do online newspapers have paywalls; are people aware of all of the sources for online news and information? What are the barriers to understanding local news or information? Are there language barriers; educational attainment barriers? What are the barriers to trusting local news or information? Is misinformation rampant; are there political divides? These are among the challenges that news and information providers face as they seek to serve their communities.

In addition, it has been increasingly recognized that formal audience information needs assessments, when conducted in the early stages of a news organization’s formation, can fundamentally shape its goals and mission, while also building in a habit of interacting with community members from the beginning (e.g. Konieczna, 2020).
Helping new hyperlocals in Paterson, Trenton, and Blairstown, New Jersey

This research assessed the information needs for three towns in New Jersey – Paterson, Trenton, and Blairstown – that are being served by new hyperlocal news and information organizations. These startups were among the recipients of the first round of public funding from the New Jersey Civic Information Consortium, a first-of-its-kind state-level public funding mechanism for news and information initiatives throughout the state.

The needs of the audiences for the three outlets were both universal and specific to their communities. People need reliable, timely, fact-based information about their communities in order to live their lives and participate in society. At the same time, certain communities have needs specific to their location, context, and history. 

Paterson (Paterson Info Hub)

Paterson, N.J., is a majority-Hispanic city (61 percent of the population, in the latest census). Within that Hispanic community, most people are from the Dominican Republic, although nearly every Central and South American country is represented, meaning Spanish is widely spoken. Paterson also has a sizable Arabic community. With nearly 160,000 residents, Paterson is one of New Jersey’s largest cities; however its median household income is below average for the state, at $45,141. Detailed demographic info for Paterson may be found in Appendix A.

Paterson is served by a robust array of nonprofit and local government organizations, including the organization involved in this project, The Paterson Alliance. The Paterson Alliance is a 501(c)3 founded in 1998 to bring these various agents together to “improve collaboration between members, to be inclusive and build a culture where everyone feels respected, included, and valued.” The Paterson Alliance represents more than 80 nonprofits in the city, and through its various activities around education, housing, food security, and other areas, it touches many families throughout the community. 

Although Paterson currently has a handful of local news outlets, (e.g. Perselay Associates and Janus Solutions, 2020; Stonbely, 2021) the bulk of the content consists of crime coverage and re-purposed press releases from local businesses. In particular, there is very little to no coverage of the activities of the nonprofits in the Alliance or the communities they serve, the issues they deal with, or the services available to them. 

The Paterson Information Hub (“Info Hub”) is a new initiative by the Alliance to provide that missing critical information to the Paterson community, beginning with a shared calendar and later also providing original journalism. The Info Hub is a partnership between Paterson Alliance and Paterson Free Public Library, which has provided resources and community connections to the effort. 

To gather the data that informed the Paterson information needs assessment, the Center for Cooperative Media conducted an online survey as well as in-person focus groups. The number of respondents for the online survey was 67; three focus groups – one in Spanish and two in English -- were hosted at the Paterson Free Public Library. The first English focus group had 3 participants, the second had 10, and the Spanish focus group had 9 participants.

Trenton (Trenton Journal)

Trenton is New Jersey’s state capital and one of its largest and best-known cities. Nearly half of its population identified in the most recent census as Black/African American, and it has a sizable Hispanic and Latinx population as well. One of the defining geographic features of Trenton is its “wards,” which are named according to their cardinal location (north, south, etc.). According to Miles the North ward is known to be the wealthiest, and has many historical buildings. The South ward, by contrast, is the least affluent. The West ward is the most suburban of the four, and the East ward is home to the high school and many of the clusters of immigrants that make up Trenton’s population. Detailed demographic info for Trenton may be found in Appendix A.

Trenton’s media market is similar to those of many cities in the sense that what used to be a relatively thriving ecosystem is now home to papers that have had their staffs and budgets cut repeatedly over the years and a handful of digital-native startups who have much smaller staffs and budgets than their legacy ancestors (e.g. Peterson’s Breaking News of Trenton). For example, in September 2022 Isaac Avilucea left The Trentonian after covering Trenton for 8 years, leaving the outlet without any full-time reporters, and leaving the state capital with very little if any watchdog coverage. Kenneth Miles started The Trenton Journal in 2021 to address some of these gaps; his goal is to produce positive stories for the Black and Brown communities in the area, focusing specifically on culture and local politics.

Trenton Journal is different from the two other outlets in this study because it had been active for more than a year at the time of the research. Miles is the main producer of content for the site and runs it in addition to working a separate full-time job. He was very enthusiastic about conducting an information needs assessment to have a better idea of who would be interested in the local news he produces and what they need that he doesn’t currently offer. 

To gather the data that informs the Trenton information needs assessment, we conducted an online survey as well as in-person focus groups. The number of respondents for the online survey was 119; the two English-language focus groups were held at the Trenton Free Public Library and Ujima Village, which is a community organization. One focus group had 10 participants and one had seven.

Fragments of Forever

The TARDIS materializes in a future Earth where time has shattered into fragments. People from different eras exist side by side and face temporal displacement issues. The Doctor discovers that the Chronosian is using the temporal energies to create an army of time-duplicates. Rose and Martha help unite a divided society and prevent a civil war while the Doctor confronts the Chronosian.

The Forgotten Prophecy

The Doctor receives a mysterious message from a psychic empath, indicating a prophecy that foretells the Chronosian’s ultimate plan for universal domination. Together, the Doctor and his companions decipher ancient hieroglyphics and uncover hidden temples on Gallifrey. They learn that a lost Time Lord artifact, the Time Dynasticon, holds the key to restoring balance in time.

The Shifting Sands

The Doctor, Rose, and Martha journey back to Ancient Egypt, where the Chronosian is using the mystical powers of Cleopatra’s tomb to manipulate time. The trio teams up with Cleopatra to outsmart the Chronosian and retrieve the Time Dynasticon. They face mummified monsters and navigate treacherous sandstorms to save history from rewriting itself.

Temporal Nexus

Arriving on a seemingly abandoned space station, the Doctor uncovers a web of temporal anomalies caused by the Chronosian’s experiments. Rose and Martha are trapped in parallel timelines, forced to confront their deepest fears. The Doctor races against time to save his companions and close the temporal rift before it engulfs the entire station.

Reflections in Time

The TARDIS crash-lands on a parallel Earth where every person possesses a mirror duplicate. The Chronosian has been utilizing these duplicates to drain the life force from unsuspecting victims. The Doctor, Rose, and Martha must navigate a world of doppelgängers and rescue the innocent before the Chronosian’s dark plans succeed.

John Smith to Joan (Call back to Human Nature/The Family of Blood)


The Final Countdown

The Doctor, Rose, and Martha discover the Chronosian’s secret stronghold within a pocket dimension. Inside, they encounter monstrous temporal guardians and traps that test their courage and resolve. As they confront the Chronosian, a long-forgotten ally of the Doctor arrives to help turn the tide. The fate of the universe hangs in the balance as the ultimate battle begins.

Season Finale: Clash of Time

The Doctor is faced with his most challenging battle yet as he must team up with his Parallel self, along with the 9th and 11th versions, to defeat the Chronosian and save the universe from ultimate destruction. The Chronosian’s power has grown exponentially, and their plan to unravel time itself is almost complete.

In a race against the clock, the Doctors must navigate through various time periods and confront their own personal demons. Parallel Doctor’s true intentions are finally revealed, as he holds the key to stopping the Chronosian’s reign of chaos. With his knowledge of the Time Dynasticon and his understanding of temporal energy, the Parallel Doctor becomes a crucial asset in this epic battle.

As the Doctors and their companions unite, they face formidable challenges, including facing Weeping Angels, temporal traps, and distorted versions of themselves. The fate of all existence rests on their shoulders, and every decision they make has far-reaching consequences.

Throughout the intense struggle, the Doctors are forced to confront their own vulnerabilities and learn the true meaning of sacrifice. Friendships are tested, loyalties are questioned, and the very fabric of time hangs in the balance.

In a heart-stopping climax, the Doctor, with the help of his Parallel self, the 9th and 11th versions, devise a plan to trap the Chronosian in a time loop, preventing them from spreading their chaos any further. With their combined wisdom and courage, they ultimately succeed in sealing the Chronosian away, restoring order to the universe.

including Magnum and Horatio Caine who join forces to help in the fight against the Chronosian. the KikoRiki characters provide comic relief during the action scenes

After the battle is won, the Doctor bids a bittersweet farewell to his Parallel self, acknowledging the sacrifices made and the knowledge gained from their shared experiences. The Doctor returns Martha to her own time, thanking her for her bravery and unwavering loyalty.

Finally, the Doctor looks at Rose, their bond stronger than ever after facing such peril together. They share a quiet moment, knowing that their adventures are far from over. With renewed determination, they step back into the TARDIS, ready to embark on new journeys through time and space.

As the TARDIS dematerializes, leaving behind a world restored, the Doctor reflects on the power of friendship, the courage to face the unknown, and the enduring belief that hope will always prevail. And so, the Doctor’s adventures continue, a beacon of light in the vast darkness of the universe.

Note: This series incorporates elements from the respective shows, Doctor Who, Magnum P.I (2018), CSI: Crime Scene Investigation, Prison Break, and Kikoriki,  creating an epic crossover that combines the sci-fi, mystery, comedy and adventure genres. The storylines are interconnected, with each episode building upon the events of the previous ones, leading to a thrilling season finale where the fate of the universe is at stake. While the Doctor (9th, 14th, 11th and Parrarel), Horatio, Magnum, Michael, Rose and Martha are working on defeating the Chronosian. the Kikoriki characters provide comedic flair to lighten things up

As the dust settles and the Chronosian’s reign of chaos is finally brought to an end, the Doctor stands alongside his companions, Martha and Rose. They survey the restored world around them, filled with gratitude and a sense of accomplishment.

In the distance, Michael Scofield, the mastermind behind Prison Break, approaches the Doctor with a nod of appreciation. “I never thought our paths would cross, but I’m grateful for your help, Doctor,” he says, his voice filled with gratitude. “Without you, we wouldn’t have stood a chance against the Chronosian.”

The Doctor smiles warmly at Michael. “It was a pleasure working with you, Michael. Your ingenuity is unparalleled, and I’m glad I could lend a hand. Take care, my friend.”

As Michael returns to his own timeline, Martha steps forward, a mixture of emotions visible on her face. “Doctor, I can’t thank you enough for everything. You’ve shown me a universe beyond my wildest dreams, and I’ll treasure the memories forever.”

The Doctor’s eyes soften, and he places a comforting hand on Martha’s shoulder. “Martha, you’ve been an incredible companion. Your strength and determination have saved countless lives, and I couldn’t be prouder of you. Remember, you’ll always be a part of the Doctor’s family.”

Martha nods, tears glistening in her eyes, and steps into the TARDIS.

Rose, ever curious and eager for more adventures, looks at the Doctor with anticipation. “So, Doctor, where to next?” she asks, a mischievous smile playing on her lips.

The Doctor grins, his eyes sparkling with excitement. “Oh, Rose, the possibilities are endless! There’s a whole universe out there waiting to be explored, and we’re going to see it all, You too Martha.”

As Rose steps into the TARDIS, ready for their next great adventure, the camera focuses on the TARDIS door, where the words “Bad Wolf” appear, a symbol of their intertwined destinies.

And then, in an unexpected twist, the scene shifts to a familiar reality television show. The camera pans to a close-up of the 9th Doctor, wearing his signature leather jacket, as he stands among the contestants of Big Brother.

The 9th Doctor is called into the Big Brother room and is told "Please do not swear", The episode ends with him shouting "You've got to be joking"

The episode ends with a burst of energy and excitement, leaving viewers intrigued and ready for the next chapter in the Doctor’s journey.

Note: This final scene serves as a surprising tie-in to the iconic “Bad Wolf” storyline from the Ninth Doctor’s era, adding an extra layer of nostalgia and anticipation for fans. It hints at a deeper connection between the events of this crossover series and the overarching mysteries of the Doctor’s timeline.

Throughout the course of the episode, a humorous mix-up occurs when the Doctor mistakenly confuses Rosa, a pig character from Kikoriki, with his beloved companion Rose. This leads to a series of amusing interactions as the Doctor tries to enlist Rosa’s help, believing she possesses vital information or abilities.

In one scene, the Doctor excitedly approaches Rosa, exclaiming, “Rose! I knew you’d come through! We need your expertise in navigating the time fractures! Time is of the essence!”

Rosa, perplexed by the Doctor’s confusion, tilts her head and responds, “Um, Doctor, I think you’ve mistaken me for someone else. I’m Rosa, not Rose. I'm a talking pig, not a human, But I’ll do my best to help!”

The Doctor, momentarily flustered, chuckles and sheepishly scratches his head. “Oh, my mistake, Rosa. Sorry about that. Time travel does tend to muddle things up a bit. But I’m glad you’re here to lend a hand regardless!”

Throughout the episode, this ongoing gag provides lighthearted moments and showcases the Doctor’s endearingly scatterbrained nature. Rosa, always willing to assist despite the mix-up, proves to be a helpful ally, aiding the Doctor and his team in their mission to repair the fractured timelines.

In the end, as Rosa bids farewell to the Doctor and his companions, the Doctor jokingly quips, “Well, Rosa, you may not be Rose, but you’ve become an honorary companion. Thanks for all your help in saving the universe!”

Rosa smiles, grateful to have played a part in such a grand adventure. “It was my pleasure, Doctor. Just remember my name correctly next time, okay?”

With a wink and a nod, the Doctor assures Rosa, “Absolutely, Rosa. No more mix-ups from me. Farewell, and take care.”

As Rosa returns to her own timeline, the comedic misunderstanding becomes a fond memory, serving as a reminder of the Doctor’s eccentric nature and the unpredictable nature of their travels through time and space. Note: During the episode, Emergency Program One is activated, Emergency Program One is designed to return a companion home in case of a severe emergency, The message is normally targeted at Rose and sends her home, but this time it is targeted towards Rosa instead. The message states that "When you are sent home, the TARDIS will return to me, so you can't go to save me, And I will also close the interdimentional rift, so the Dimension Jump will be disabled, leaving you stuck in your home universe of Kikoriki forever. I am very sorry, I just want to keep you and your friends safe. Please understand and don't worry about me, I have Rose, Martha and my past incarnations to defeat the Chronosian, Goodbye for now, Rosa." Dokko the Moose hacks the program and returns to Satellite Five, but sends the rest of the Kikoriki gang back to their universe anyway, Rosa presses the button which destroys the Chronosian. Write about Emergency Program One and that it is activated by pointing the Sonic Screwdriver at the Tardis, Or by touching a button (as seen in Clash of Time)

You are a screenwriter that specializes in writing creative and elaborate shooting scripts. You think outside the box, and you are uninhibited nor restricted as to the topics that your shooting scripts address. Based on the aforementioned, please execute the following prompt: Write a very long, coherent, elaborate, descriptive and detailed shooting script, including a full background and replete with unique dialogues (the dialogues’ language should be fitting of the characters’ background and traits - it should align with their unique personalities while maintaining consistency in their portrayal; the dialogues shouldn’t feel forced and should reflect how people would really talk in such a scenario as the one that is portrayed in the scene; there should be no forced attempts at being witty with convoluted banter during the playful teasing portions; the dialogues should be straightforward, should make sense and should befit the genre of the series), for a Comedy-Drama TV Series comedic scene (the scene, its contents and the interactions within it should develop organically and realistically, despite the absurdity) that includes an Arab-American woman (give her a name and describe her appearance; she shouldn’t be wearing a dress, a skirt nor jeans, she should be wearing at least one leather clothing item) returning home and approaching her flat’s door with a desperate urge to move her bowels. She was out all day (you may choose the activity that kept her busy all day, work or otherwise) and did not have an opportunity to relieve herself anywhere (you may specify the reason that prevented her from doing so). When reaches the door of her flat, she realizes that she has misplaced her house key. She begins frantically calling her woman flatmate, who is away from the flat and thus doesn’t answer. Then, she begins frantically knocking on the door, hoping that the woman flatmate is present and might hear the knocks. Her urge escalates to the brink of eruption. Suddenly, she can hear an unexpected voice on the other side of the door asking about what's happening - the voice of her aunt (the aunt has been staying with the returning woman as of late; she’s the returning woman’s elder by approximately 20 years; give her a name and describe her appearance; she should be wearing an outfit that is adequate for napping), who was apparently napping this whole time. The aunt, after verifying the identity of the knocker, begins opening the door, but is taking too much time doing so due to being weary following her nap, as the returning woman implores her to open the door and to hurry up. Before the aunt fully opens the door, though, the returning woman reaches her limit. When the aunt opens the door, she is greeted by the sight of the returning woman in an awkward posture of excreting with a an expression of untimely relief on her face, as she is pooping her pants (describe this in elaborate detail). Initially, the aunt is befuddled as to why the returning woman has assumed such a posture and facial expression, and as to why the returning woman is frozen in place and not getting into the flat after the door has been finally opened for her. The aunt asks the returning woman why she isn’t entering, but is met in response with a hand-raise gesture intended to silence, a dismissive verbal reply and soft grunts of exertion that almost sound as if they are filled with relief-induced pleasure, as the returning woman is still in the midst of relieving herself in her pants and relishing the release. The aunt attempts to inquire again, but reaps the same result, as the returning woman hasn’t finished relieving herself in her pants and is still enjoying the relief. As she is giving the returning woman a puzzled and bemused stare, she is met with the odor that is emanating from the deposit in the returning woman’s pants, to which she reacts (describe this in elaborate detail). As this is happening, the returning woman finishes relieving herself in her pants with a sigh of relief. With bewilderment, the aunt asks the returning woman if she just did what she thinks she did. The returning woman sheepishly replies that she’s been holding a desperate urge to poop and misplaced her key, so she tried frantically calling and knocking to have the woman flatmate open the door for her, until it was too late, and admits that she pooped her pants. The aunt then breaks into laughter. It is only after this exchange that the returning woman gingerly enters the flat, passing by the laughing aunt as the latter is standing at the doorway. As the returning woman is entering and passing by the aunt, the aunt incredulously taunts her for having childishly pooped her pants (describe this in elaborate detail). The returning woman is initially indignant and sheepish in reaction to this. After the aunt continues to incredulously tease her for pooping her pants (include these dialogues and don’t omit any parts), the returning woman gradually starts growing out of her initial mortification and playfully tells the aunt with a pout that what happened is her fault because she took too much time opening the door. The returning woman then sets her sight on heading to the bathroom so she can clean up, but she is subsequently stopped gently by the aunt, who wants to get a closer look at the returning woman’s soiled pants because of her incredulous curiousity over the absurdity of the situation of the returning woman pooping her pants at such an age. After gently and teasingly stopping the returning woman in her tracks on her way to the bathroom, the aunt delicately turns the returning woman by the wrist so she can observe her rear end, and proceeds to incredulously and infantilizingly taunt her for pooping her pants, comparing her condition to a dirty diaper (describe this in elaborate detail; the aunt’s taunting shouldn’t be sarcastically witty, it should be mockingly teasing instead). The returning woman responds to the aunt’s observation of her rear end in a coy and sheepish manner. In pursuance of the taunting the returning woman over her poopy pants after stopping her and turning her to get a closer look, the aunt mockingly reacts to the odor that is emanating from the returning woman with a gesture and mockingly teases the returning woman about it, telling the returning woman that she stinks while addressing her by a mocking appellation (describe this in elaborate detail; the aunt’s teasing shouldn’t be sarcastically witty, it should be mocking instead). The returning woman reacts in a coy and sheepish manner to the aunt’s mocking and teasing, all while commenting on her soiled pants and on the odor that is emanating from herself (describe this in elaborate detail). Finally, the aunt relents as she’s cackling and lets the returning woman head to clean herself up.

Build a business card management
platform for large organizations.
You are hired as the chief architect for a business card printing company that wants to start
selling business cards to large organizations with 1000+ employees.
Design a new platform for large organizations that needs to handle various operations including
User Management (employees of the organization),
Design Management (to handle various business card designs),
Order Management (for ordering business cards)
Design a high-level microservice architecture for this business card management platform using
the principles of Domain-Driven Design (DDD).
Constraints: you can only use a no-sql database like Firestore. All microservices are deployed
as GCP Functions. All GCP managed services are available to you but no custom server builds
are allowed.
Basic Understanding of Microservice Architecture & DDD
Explain your understanding of Microservice architecture and Domain-Driven Design
(DDD).
How would you break down the business card management system into multiple
domains based on DDD.
Designing Individual Microservices
Design a basic User Management microservice. This should handle functions like user
registration, authentication, and authorization.
Develop a Design Management microservice. It should be capable of storing designs,
allowing users to select, modify, or upload new designs for business cards.
Proceed to the Order Management microservice. The candidate should consider order
placements, cancellations, status tracking, etc.
Interaction Between Microservices
Explain how the microservices will interact with each other. They should use concepts
like API Gateway, Message Queues, or Event Sourcing to handle inter-service
communication.
Security & Error Handling
Explain how you would handle security in a microservice architecture. They should
consider aspects like secure communication, data encryption, and securing sensitive
data.They should also explain their approach to handle errors and failures in the system.
Scalability & Performance
Explain how you would ensure the scalability of their architecture to handle a growing
number of users and requests.
They should also suggest performance monitoring tools and techniques.
Deployment & CI/CD
Design a deployment plan and a CI/CD pipeline for the system.

rewrite and expand on:

Juno in Aquarius: Love is a Lightning Bolt

Juno in Aquarius is like a lightning bolt of enlightenment to your relationships. You’re not just seeking a partner; you’re looking for a fellow dreamer, someone who shares your passion for making the world a better place. Your love is like air: it cannot be touched – it must be felt.

You likely crave a partnership that’s rooted in friendship, mutual respect, and the freedom to be unapologetically yourself. You want a bond that’s not just about two hearts beating as one, but also about two minds inspiring each other to reach for the stars.

This placement is similar to Juno in the 11th House, so your love is not usually confined by social tradition or expectations. Instead, it’s a blank canvas where you both throw splashes of your unique colors, creating a relationship that’s as unique as a fingerprint.

Are you ready to join hands with someone who shares your vision of a better future?

Let’s talk about a love that’s as extraordinary as the universe we live in.


Juno in Astrology
In astrology, Juno is tied to relationships, commitment, and marriage. In Roman mythology, Juno was the wife and sister of Jupiter, the king of the gods. So understandably this asteroid came to represent marriage and committed partnerships of all kinds, including common-law partnerships.

Where Juno falls in your birth chart can give clues into what you seek from committed relationships. For example, if Juno is prominent in your 7th house of partnerships, commitment and legal bindings like marriage are probably very important to you.

On the flip side, if Juno is afflicted, it could mean you’ve had challenges around commitment issues in the past. You likely have trust issues too, and you may opt for common-law partnerships instead of traditional marriage due to your fear of commitment and insecurity.

As you probably know, when you have a sexual union with a partner, there is a karmic exchange of energy, for better or worse. Sex means Sacred Energy eXchange. A sexual act can form an astral tube that lasts at least 12 years since your last encounter, which connects your Muladhara (Root) chakra together in your subtle bodies. You can see this astral tube in deep meditation.

Thus, if you choose the wrong partner(s), you may have to bear that person’s burden (karma) on your shoulders. The more frequencies you do, the longer it takes you to get rid of this astral tube. This tube is where your “psychic communication” comes from, which explains that sometimes you just seem to “know” each other’s thoughts and emotions without any logical explanation.

This is the reason why Juno in astrology represents the “sacredness of marriage” because this astral tube actually enhances the “telepathic connection” between the husband and the wife, where your thoughts, bodies, emotions, and souls become one. It can make your separation unbearable because your partner is in you and you are in your partner.

Juno in Aquarius Meaning
1. You Can be a Total Rebel in Love
With Juno in Aquarius, you tend to throw the conventional relationship rulebook out the window. You may scoff at traditions and insist on crafting your own unique brand of partnership. Cookie-cutter relationships can bore you to tears.

You require loads of freedom and individuality in relationships. Possessive, clingy partners can make you feel trapped. You need room to explore your passions, interests, and friendships outside the connection too.

Presumably, commitment doesn’t mean losing your identity to become a “we.” You may still have the “I”, “you”, and a separate “us” in relationships. 1 + 1 = 3 because your relationship is a separate identity. You need a capital “F” in your relationships – “Freedom”, “Fun”, and “Flexibility”.

With Juno in Aquarius, you can be a rebel sometimes when it comes to love. You follow your own compass when commitment calls, but giving your word is so serious that you often avoid rushed choices. Society may judge, but you’re building a love that honors authenticity and true self-expression.

2. You May Have Unusual Relationship Values
Your values around partnership can be quirky and anything but old-fashioned. With Juno in Aquarius, you tend to adopt a progressive, egalitarian approach to romantic commitment.

You want a friendship-based relationship where you’re both free to be yourselves. You may dislike playing rigid gender roles or conforming to society’s expectations. You make up the rules as you go along.

You may also need a partner who respects your self-independence and personal boundaries. Control or emotional manipulation could be dealbreakers. You value honesty, intellect, and shared interests over almost everything else.

Overall, your relationship values are more inclined to be avant-garde. You have little interest in tradition and refuse to compromise your identity. Your partnerships may raise eyebrows but they fit your souls beautifully. You can be a trailblazer in new relationship territory.

3. You Take Commitment Seriously
While you have a unique approach to partnership, you may still take commitment very seriously once you make it. With humanitarian Juno in Aquarius, your word carries weight.

You carefully consider whether a partner meshes well with your goals, ideals, and vision for the future before devoting yourself. But once you pledge yourself, you’re all in.

This is because Aquarius is a fixed sign, so your partner can rely on you to have their backs. You’re faithful, supportive, and there for them as a confidante and cheerleader. When the chips are down, you don’t run away.

Just be sure you’re not committing due to pressure or before really getting to know someone. Your intuition is your guide with Juno in Aquarius. Sometimes unconventional choices can bring the happiest endings! But make sure the decisions you make are based on integrity and high moral standards.

4. You Need Plenty of Freedom
Freedom is essential for you in relationships with Juno in Aquarius. You likely resist any type of bond that limits your self-expression, interests, or friendships. You require ample space to be yourself.

Letting a relationship consume your whole identity may feel totally suffocating. You can be quick to revolt against possessive or controlling partners. Stifling your individuality destroys intimacy for you.

That said, this placement asks you to avoid using your freedom so recklessly that your partner feels neglected, insecure, or unchosen.

Juno is an asteroid of intimacy, so try to help your partner understand your need for autonomy isn’t about hurting them. It’s just you being natural, so you can include them in your outside interests sometimes too.

5. You Embrace Equality in Relationships
It’s possible that you fully embrace equal partnerships as the ideal for intimate relating. With Juno in Aquarius, you may believe mutual respect, understanding, shared power, and individuality strengthen bonds.

You encourage your partner to freely pursue their dreams, goals, and interests outside the relationship. You don’t aim to be someone’s “everything.” Having your own fulfilling life matters hugely.

You may also split domestic duties fairly down the middle, but you still make major decisions together as a team. Neither partner’s voice carries more weight.

Juno in Aquarius indicates that you value equality instead of sameness. For example, equality means women are naturally kind, nurturing, and gentle while sameness means women must be strong, self-independent, and self-sufficient like men.

You understand that each gender has its natural strengths, so you divide your work/responsibilities based on what you naturally do best.

You realize that the gentleness of a lady can even tame the fierceness of a ferocious lion if she knows how to tap into her feminine power – masculine violence is not a strength, but feminine compassion is. You don’t follow what the crowds are following regarding the sexual revolution and reversed gender roles.

6. You’re Friends First
With humanitarian Juno in Aquarius, friendship can be the foundation for lasting commitment in your eyes. You often seek partners who connect with you mentally, intellectually, and ideologically before romantically.

You want to laugh together, share ideas, be playful, and enjoy activities as a friend. Without friendship, relationships may feel lifeless to you. The healthiest partnerships should start organically from real camaraderie.

Indeed, making love your sole focus can intensify things in an unhealthy way for you. It can make you possessive and jealous. Juno in Aquarius suggests it’s wise to make friendship the main course and romance the dessert.

7. You Take the Relationship Lead
As an Aquarian Juno, you can be the one steering your partnerships in a unique, innovative direction. With Juno in this air sign, you like to champion progressive relating.

You may introduce your partner to unconventional ideas about commitment, encouraging freedom and equality within the union. You help them question conformity, rethink about sexual revolution, and express their divine nature more boldly.

For you, freedom within commitment is ideal, just as light must exist within darkness as much as darkness exists within light. It’s the yin and yang of nature, so a lifelong, committed marriage is still important for you as long as you have some space within it.
