Characterisation of mango pectin extracted via microwave
Abstract
This study investigates the viability of microwave-assisted extraction as an alternative to traditional acid extraction for obtaining pectin from mango peel, a by-product of mango processing. Utilising microwave technology presents a more energy-efficient and less chemically intensive method for pectin extraction, aligning with the sustainability goals of the UN. Keitt mangoes were chosen for this study due to high waste valorising potential. Comparison of the extraction methods, both with multiple reaction conditions tested, showed that microwave extraction at 140⁰c provided a pectin with the most desirable properties, which was the best compromise of degree of esterification (DE) and yield (42.7322% and 0.2071g respectively). Further analysis assessed the quality of the extracted pectin against JEFCA standards through measurements of purity parameters, such as loss on drying and nitrogen content. While the study demonstrated that the pectin could yield desirable properties, it fell short in some of the purity parameters, making the resultant pectin’s applicability in the food industry limited by its compositional properties. However, it’s potential in medicinal application, with it being a low methoxy pectin (LMP) and the plausible presence of calcium pectinate (CaP) salts, warrants further investigation. In conclusion, while microwave-assisted extraction offers a viable, environmentally friendly method for pectin extraction , achieving commercial viability requires addressing the purity and composition challenges, with future research being to aim for optimisation of extraction conditions and exploring the full range of possible applications for the extracted pectin, considering its unique properties.     
Introduction
The large amount of food waste worldwide has a massive impact the raw materials  in food production, creating a global environmental and social imbalance that affect third world countries the most[1]. In the UK alone, 9.5 million tonnes of food waste is produced, not only releasing 36 million tonnes of CO2 emission equivalents, but also costing the government £19 billion[2]. It does not help that 70% of this waste could have been eaten, in a world where up to 783 million people have limited access to food[3]. This also does not fall in line with the Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) target 12.3 (‘By 2030 halve per capita global food waste… and reduce food losses along production and supply chains, including post-harvest losses’) where it has only reduced by 13.2% globally[4], and with less than 7 years left of the SDGs implementation, drastic changes must happen in the near future in order to reach this target.
Approximately 14% of food produced is lost between harvest and retail[5], and in the case of fruits this will be due to either how it is processed before being put on retail, purposely thrown away due to the products aesthetics or it is spoiling before reaching retail[6]. Processed fruit generates 2 types of waste: liquid waste, as a result of juicing and water used to wash the fruit, and solid waste, for example the peel that equates to around 15 to 60% of the solid waste[7]. The solid fruit waste can be valorised by extracting compounds that can be used in multiple industries, e.g. semisolids, i.e. creams or ointments, with oils extracted from the seed[8].
Mangoes are an interesting fruit with high solid waste valorising potential; there are many cultivars of mangoes harvested around the world, such as Alphonso from India and Tommy Atkins from the United States of America. They are a fruit growing in popularity, with 43,000 tonnes being imported into the UK in 2022[9]. The by-products of mango processing totals 35-60% of the weight of the fruit (peel, kernel, seed)[10], and contains several extractable compounds, including antioxidants such as xanthone C-glycosides[11] and dietary fibres[12]. With each variety of mango having different amounts of extractable compounds, specific species can be exploited for valorisation in different industries. One extractable compound, with potential use in multiple industries, that all mangoes contain a large amount is pectin.
Pectin is a polysaccharide used by plants for cell wall adhesion[13] and has influences in other parts of  plants morphogenesis such as root elongation[14]. It is a family of galacturonic acids derived from the monomer uronic acid; with the cell walls of mango peel containing approximately 52% uronic acid[15], there is large prospects for valorising the peel for galacturonic acids, with potential to compete with the main sources of commercially available pectin, which are citrus peel, apple pomace and sugar beet pulp[16].The residues of homogalacturonan (HG) can be methylated on C6 or acetylated on O2 or O3 on the carbohydrate ring to form esters[17]; some of the C6 esters can be unmethylated, leaving a negative charge, which can interact with calcium ions that helps support the adhesion of pectin chains and gelatinisation, dubbed the ‘egg-box’ model[18]. This gelling effect caused by the HG-calcium ion interactions means that when extracted from the peels, pectin has applications in the food industry as a thickening agent in jams, jellies, and milk products[19], making it a non-meat alternative to gelatine for the diets of people who choose to, e.g. vegetarians and vegans, or cannot consume specific meat products, such as Muslims. It can also be used in medicine to coat drugs and formulate capsules that are pH dependent for delivery to specific parts of the body[20]. 
Pectin extraction has been done industrially since the late 20th century via acid stewing, but it is not very efficient;. the vat required to heat up the water and maintain the temperature for several hours requires a lot of energy[22], in addition to the acid that can potentially produce unwanted byproducts, thus decreasing the yield and quality of the pectin that can be extracted. Microwave technology can breakdown the mango peel without the need for acid, as well as requiring less energy to heat the mango[22], making it a viable method replacement of acid extraction. Microwave-assisted extraction has been researched on and trialled since 2015[23], with one of the more noteworthy papers looks at a Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) of extracted pectin from citrus peel at pilot scale[22]. The first aim of this study is to show a comparison between acid and microwave-assisted extraction, showing that microwave technology is a viable alternative to the traditional method. A second aim of this study is to compare the results obtained from this research to the results from this paper[22] and suggest if mango peel is viable competitor of citrus peel for pectin extraction. This comparison will be done on a larger batch of pectin that will be extracted via the conditions determined to be the best from the comparison of methods and conditions.
In 2009, the FAO published a pectin characterisation tests and purity parameters in the JEFCA Monographs[23], with purity tests including loss on drying, galacturonic acid contents and nitrogen contents, setting requirements to ensure safety for human consumption. While at a laboratory-scale study, the parameters cannot be tested in the required method due to the amount of pectin needed being unable to be made in a small timescale , approximations of some can be found through other methods that require much less yield. The final aim of this study is to obtain approximate purity values of parameters that can be tested on the larger batch of pectin, and to propose if a move to a larger scale of research is needed. 
Methods
Materials                                                                                                                                                    Keitt mangoes, from Brazil, were sourced from a local supermarket and processed to acquire the peel via a sharp knife, with the flesh removed with a  stainless steel spoon. From 10 mangoes, 817g of peel was obtained.
All chemicals used, i.e. ethanol, HCl, H2SO4 and phenolphthalein, were purchased from Fischer Chemicals and used without further purification. 
Pectin extraction and purification                                                                                                                                                                        Pectin extraction was attempted using the traditional method (acid stewing) and microwave-assisted extraction. The traditional method consisted of  a 1hr reflux on 10g of peel and aqueous HCl in 4 different conditions; temperatures of 85⁰c and 100⁰c, and peel to solvent ratios (p:s) of 1:10 (0.03M HCl) and 1:30 (0.01M HCl) were both tested, with the mango filtered out after the hour. The microwave-assisted extraction uses a CEM MARS 6 extraction system, in which 5g of peel and 50ml of water is put into each easy prep plus vessel with a stirrer flea. 4 different temperatures were tested (100⁰c, 120⁰c, 140⁰c, and 160⁰c), with the power set to 600W. Both methods resulted with aqueous solutions containing pectin. Pectin was isolated from the solution with the addition of excess ethanol (c.a. 2.5:1 ratio of ethanol to water) under rapid stirring for 20 minutes, with the solution left overnight for maximum precipitation. Centrifugation is then needed for further isolation, which was done with a Thermo Megafuge Centrifuge at 3900rpm for 20 minutes (acceleration value at 9 and deceleration value at 3), with falcon tubes containing 40ml of a 5:3 ratio of solution to ethanol. The resultant pectin pellet was extracted and purified by boiling in excess ethanol for 15 minutes before hot filtering with a sinter funnel to obtain an off-white solid. The solid is put into the freezer for 4 hours before undergoing freeze-drying to obtain the final product[10].                              
Characterisation of Pectin
Degrees of Esterification (DE) using infrared spectroscopy (IR)                                                                  Attenuated total reflectance IR (ATR-IR) was achieved using a Perkin Elmer Spectrum 400 IR. The spectra was taken at a range of 4000cm-1 to 650cm-1, with a blank background reading. After the spectra is produced, it is converted to absorbance, from transmittance, and with the areas of the ester and acid peaks calculated (c.a. 1750cm-1 and 1600cm-1 respectively), the DE is determined as a percentage of the ester peak against the total area.
Degrees of Esterification via titration (DEt)                                                                                            500mg is moistened with 2ml of ethanol before being dissolved in 100ml of deionised water. 5 drops of phenolphthalein is added and was titrated with 0.5M NaOH (denoted as initial titre). Thereafter 10ml of 0.5M NaOH was added and mixed vigorously, with the solution allowed to stand for 15 minutes. 10ml of 0.5 HCl was added after, and the solution was shaken until the pink colour disappeared. 5 drops of phenolphthalein was added to the solution and it was titrated again with 0.5M NaOH to a faint pink colour persisted after shaking (end point). This was recorded as the final titre. The DEt was calculated with the following equation: DEt (%) = (final titre)/(initial titre+final titre)×100[25]. 
Galacturonic acid contents                                                                                                                     100mg of pectin (denoted as W) is mixed with 1ml of 72% H2SO4 and subjected to shaking in a water bath (40⁰c), being stirred every 5 to 10 minutes for 2 hours with a glass stirring rod. Thereafter, 28 ml of deionised water is added to the mixture, before autoclaved for 1 hour at 121⁰c. The resulting hydrolysed sample is filtered through a sinter funnel, and the liquid is further filtered through a RC 0.22µm filter dish before subjected for galacturonic acid analysis via HPLC[26].
Loss on drying                                                                                                                                                             25mg of the sample in a sample vial is placed in a biomass drying oven at 105⁰c for 2 hours. After leaving to cool until the sample reaches room temperature, the mass is recorded after and the difference is measured as a percentage.
Nitrogen contents                                                                                                                                            The percentage of nitrogen is obtained using CHN analysis with a Thermo Flash CHNS-O, and is given as a percentage.
Total insolubles                                                                                                                                    After filtration of the sample for galacturonic acid analysis, the mass of the sinter funnel with the hydrolysed solid is measured (denoted as W0). The solid is washed with deionised water before the sinter funnel is placed in a biomass drying oven for 1 hour at 105⁰c. The mass of the sinter funnel with the dried solid is measured (denoted as W1). The calculation can be performed with the equation:  Insoluble pectin (%) = (W1- W0)/W×100[26].    

Results and Discussions

Determination of the best method and condition
The degrees of esterification obtained from acid reflux conditions ranged from 30.82% to 37.05%, in comparison to microwave conditions which range from 32.09% to 43.16%. DE is defined as a percentage of the preservation of the esterified carboxyl bonds in comparison to the total amount of carboxyl bonds in pectin[27]. It is a measurement of pectin quality that is easily influenced by the extraction conditions, and as it can be determined quickly through IR, it makes for an ideal parameter to compare the two methods, and the different conditions for each of them. Pectin can be classed as either high methoxy pectin (HMP), where the DE is greater than 50%, or low methoxy pectin (LMP), in which DE is less than 50%. LMP’s are seen as more valuable due to gelation able to be achieved with calcium ions at a wider range of pH in comparison to HMP, which require an environment with high sugar content[27]; however a pectin with a low DE tends to be more brittle due to the dependency on calcium ions to maintain the gelation[28]. From Table 1, it can be concluded that microwave extraction at 140⁰c performed the best of any of the conditions tested as it shows a balance between DE and yield; the DE is low enough to meet the LMP threshold, but not too low that if left to form a gel, it is not too brittle, and the yield obtained is much larger than most of the other tested conditions. This was enough justification that the batch of pectin to be further characterised was extracted with this method and condition. It was interesting to observe that the highest yield, which was from acid reflux at 85⁰c and a peel to solvent ratio of 1:30, was a 35% increase to what was recorded with the microwave at 140⁰c; an unexcepted result as it has been recorded that at more optimal conditions, microwave-assisted extraction should have a greater yield recorded in comparison to acid stewing[10, 22]. This led to a side experiment, in which 2 more microwave reactions at 140⁰c took place with the same amount of mango peel and 50ml of 0.01M HCl and H2SO4 solution instead of water. Sulphuric acid is tested as it is another acid that can be used in acid extraction[29].

Acid	DE (%)	Yield (g)
HCl	50.6012	0.0521
H2SO4	54.7417	0.0738
Microwave extraction with acid solution                                                                                                            The aim of this was only to see whether the replacement of water for acid solution would have an effect on the yield or DE. The data in Table 2 shows that the addition of acid had increased DE to 54.7417% and 50.6012%, but decreased yield by approximately 64% and 75% for H2SO4 and HCl respectively. The increase in DE indicates that the use of acid solution in the microwave vessels compared to deionised water aids in the preservation of the esterified carboxyl groups; this may have occurred as under acidic conditions, the ester bonds are less likely to hydrolyse compared to the glycosidic bonds that are located in the main pectic polysaccharide chain, and the microwave more likely enhances this effect with more even energy distribution in comparison to acid stewing. The decrease in yield could also have happened for the same reason, in which the combination of both is favoured for glycosidic bond hydrolysis; this leads to higher amounts of premature pectin chain termination, which is more solubilised in the acidic conditions and are not so easily recovered in the purification process. A higher DE for H2SO4 comes from the way the sulphate ions interact with the pectin environment, affecting the solubility and stability of the extractable polysaccharide in a way that aids the release from the peel. The reason that H2SO4 also recorded a higher yield than HCl is that it is a diprotic acid[30] instead of a monoprotic acid; the donation of 1 more proton per molecule, and the accumulation of these extra protons lead to more effective protonation of the ester linkages, which promotes hydrolysis of pectin to more extractable fragments. While these results are noteworthy, this experiment was to only see what effect the combination of acid solution and microwave technology would do for pectin extraction, and has no bearing on the overall conclusion of this report. 
Characterisation of pectin extracted from microwave at 140⁰c
Purity 	Criteria (%)	Results (%)
DE	-	41.7780
DEt	-	46.1034
Loss on drying	<12	11.0336
Total insoluble	<3	4.0527
Nitrogen content	<2.5	0.58
Galacturonic acid content	>65	37.2361
Degree of Esterification                                                                                                         The DE, determined via IR, was recorded at 41.7780%, which is similar to what was observed with the result from Table 1, showing consistency with analytical precision. While IR is a quick method to obtain a DE value, there are a few limitations. an example is baseline drift, in which the line either side of the peak does not return to absolute 0, but will instead be shown as an elevated baseline. This can come across due to sample characteristics or atmospheric absorption, and affect the DE as a true value cannot be determined. Titrimetry is another method of DE determination, and while it is a more versatile method with less sensitivity to sample conditions than IR, it still has limitations, such as endpoint determination. The combination of both methods can be used for cross verification of results,  and as similar values are recorded, then there is an increase in the confidence that the true DE value is within the range of both values (41.7780 – 46.1034%). Comparing this to what was attained from citrus peel in Tom et al’s paper[22] (72.8%), both have a vast difference in esterification, and are clearly meant for different applications, with the citrus restricted to high-sugar jams and jellies, as well as less potential uses in medicine[28].
Loss on drying                                                                                                                                Loss on drying was found to be at 11.0336%, which meets the threshold of 12% maximum loss of sample mass. This primarily shows that the pectin has a desirable quality and integrity that is crucial for applications in the food industry, due to excessive moisture in pectin that could lead to microbial growth or spoilage, and decreasing shelf life. The adherence of the pectin batch to the JEFCA requirements is indicative of the efficacy of the purification process, as it shows that the use of the freeze-dryer in the drying stage is removing the desired amount of moisture without overly dehydrating the pectin, which could potentially compromise quality and functionality. Again comparing this to the results in the LCA paper (8.98%), the difference shows that process that they undertook was more effective in drying out excess moisture out of the pectin that what was done here, which would result in a longer shelf life than the mango pectin.
Total insolubles                                                                                                                             The upper limit for total insoluble is 3%, and as can be seen in Table 3, the recorded value (4.0527%) is above the limit. This could be due to the formation of calcium pectinate (CaP) salts; With the egg-box model of pectin and calcium interactions, this facilitates the cross-linking that is formed between the ions and the HG chains, forming a three-dimensional structure. This forms a CaP gel[31], and with changes to the conditions, in time this will crystalise to form an insoluble salt. The presence of this salt will contribute to the total weight of the insoluble fraction. The contrast between this result and what was obtained in Tom et al’s paper[22] (0.29%), despite it only being approximately 3.7%, is quite significant, as one is far below the threshold and the other is far above it, showing a vast difference in purity. While the presence of CaP is not ideal for applications in the food industry, there has been research for use of these salts in medicine, for example in colonic drug delivery with silica-coated beads[32], in which the aim would be to exploit the conditions in the gastrointestinal tract to allow for conditioned release of drugs, showing that there is still potential use for this sample for a different application despite not meeting the JEFCA requirement.
Nitrogen content                                                                                                                                       The nitrogen content that was recorded (0.58%) falls well within the 2.5% maximum threshold from the JEFCA requirements. This shows that the pectin chains have a high level of purity, with little nitrogen-containing compounds present. Nitrogen contents mainly test for two types of compounds, one type being protein insolubles; while most proteins would be removed in the extraction and purification process, it is feasible that not all would be removed. These are considered impurities, and can affect the gelling properties of the pectin. The other type of nitrogen-containing compound that could be present are alkaloids. These are naturally occurring toxic amines that are produced by plants as a defence mechanism, and consumption of these amines can lead to disruption in multiple parts of the body, such as the central nervous system[33]. It is important to test for nitrogen contents as  a result over the threshold means a possibility of the presence of alkaloids, making it unsafe for food and medicinal applications. 
Contents	%
Galacturonic acid 	37.2361
Cellulose	23.5518
Xylose/Fructose/Mannose/Rhamnose	11.1903
Arabinose	16.7895
Levoglucosan	7.0759
Others	4.1902
Galacturonic Acid Content                                                                                                                    From HPLC, it was determined that the content of galacturonic acid was 37.2361%. This is significantly lower than the minimum requirement set by JEFCA (>65%), and what was obtained in Tom et al paper on citrus fruit (72.3%). A reason for this could be the raw material that was used, in which Keitt mangoes may have inherently low levels of galacturonic acid content; the results suggests this as a high presence of other sugars can be seen; 23.5518% of the sample is the cellulose, which can be extracted and used as a dietary fibre[34]. 27.9798% of the contents are sugars that are present in hemicellulose (Fructose & Mannose) and ‘hairy’ pectin (Xylose, Rhamnose & Arabinose). Hemicellulose are matrix polysaccharides that form hydrogen bonds to cellulose microfibrils[35] to help strengthen the cell wall. They can be formed by different monosaccharides, and can also be used as a dietary fibre[36]. ‘Hairy’ pectin is a region of the chain that has branching of other monosaccharides, as shown in Figure 3. This can disrupt the gelling behaviour of the pectin as they can interfere with the ‘egg-box’ interactions of calcium ions and the ‘smooth’ galacturonic acid pectin region. Levoglucosan is a product of cellulose pyrolysis[37], whereas the results denoted as ‘Others’ in Table 4 are not, they are degradation products of galacturonic acids; these show that the conditions the microwave produce have an unwanted side effect of breaking down polysaccharide chains, which can reduce purity of the sample and the yield obtained. The presence of all of these products at such a high proportion, in comparison to how little galacturonic acid there is in the sample shows a high level of impurity that no other JEFCA parameter has been able to measure, and presents the case that it is not ready to move to higher scale research.
Yield                                                                                                                                              0.977g of pectin was extracted from 60g of Keitt mango peel, equating to a yield of 1.62%. Comparing to the literature, in 2016 paper by Avtar et al [10], a dry weight yield of 11.63% from 20g of dried mango peel, and in the LCA paper, 150g of pectin was extracted from 3kg of citrus peel, which reflects an extraction efficiency of 5%. What must be noted is that the pectin from this research was obtained through undried mango peel, which impacts how much can be extracted due to the high moisture content of fresh peel, which can vary between ~59 to ~69% of mango cultivars[38]. Based on these moisture numbers, a theoretical yield from dry peel can be obtained using the mean moisture content (64%) by finding the dry mass of the fresh peel and obtaining a yield percentage based on that; using this, the dry peel mass would be 21.6g (60g×0.36=21.6g), meaning the percentage would have been 4.61%. This is quite comparable to the citrus peel, showing a minor decrease, but as that was done with a much larger amounts of peel, a downscaled extraction could increase yield percentage difference. What this does is bring up the question of whether it is worth it to valorise Keitt mango peel for pectin as the primary source, or to obtain it as a side product, for applications in the food industry. Looking at the HPLC results, 23.55% of the 0.977g of pectin was actually cellulose as an unintended side product; cellulose extraction efficiency of mango peel has been recorded at 44.6%[39], and with this it seems that it would be better to have cellulose as the main extraction product of Keitt mango peel, and to see whether pectin can be extracted as a side product.


Conclusion
The use of microwaves as a means to extract pectin from mango peel is a viable alternative and potential replacement of the traditional acid extraction method, with more optimal conditions providing the best compromise between DE and yield (42.7322% and 0.2071g respectively), showing the potential of microwave technology for valorisation of food wastes for biobased chemicals and materials. The data also shows that the source is not be a viable competitor of some of the main sources of pectin, such as citrus peel, but there is potential to compete with other LMP sources; this would need more research to optimise as the data obtained from the research also shows that using Keitt mango peel as a source of pectin for applications in the food industry is not a viable source, as some of the purity parameters  that JEFCA have set to regulate commercial pectin production (galacturonic acid contents and total insolubles) have not been met. There might be potential use for the pectin for medicinal uses instead, with some of the total insolubles potentially being CaP salts. However further research would need to occur to confirm the presence of the salts.

Write a very long, coherent, elaborate, descriptive and detailed shooting script, including a full background and replete with unique dialogues (the dialogues’ language should be fitting of the characters’ background and traits - it should align with their unique personalities while maintaining consistency in their portrayal; the dialogues shouldn’t feel forced and should reflect how people would really talk in such a scenario as the one that is portrayed in the scene; there should be no forced attempts at being witty with convoluted banter during the playful teasing portions; the dialogues should be straightforward, should make sense and should befit the genre of the series), for a Comedy-Drama TV Series comedic scene (the scene, its contents and the interactions within it should develop organically and realistically, despite the absurdity) that includes an Mexican-American woman (give her a name and describe her appearance; she shouldn’t be wearing a dress, a skirt nor jeans) returning home and approaching her flat’s door with a desperate urge to move her bowels. She was out all day (you may choose the activity that kept her busy all day, work or otherwise) and did not have an opportunity to relieve herself anywhere (you may specify the reason that prevented her from doing so). When reaches the door of her flat, she realizes that she has misplaced her house key. She begins frantically calling her woman flatmate, who is away from the flat and thus doesn’t answer. Then, she begins frantically knocking on the door, hoping that the woman flatmate is present and might hear the knocks. Her urge escalates to the brink of eruption. Suddenly, she can hear an unexpected voice on the other side of the door asking about what's happening - the voice of her aunt, who she wasn't expecting to see and would've rather avoided altogether in such a predicament (the aunt has been staying with the returning woman as of late; she’s the returning woman’s elder by approximately 20 years; give her a name and describe her appearance; she should be wearing an outfit that is adequate for napping). The aunt was apparently napping inside the flat this whole time. The aunt, after verifying the identity of the knocker, begins opening the door, but is taking too much time doing so due to being weary following her nap, as the returning woman implores her to open the door and to hurry up. As the aunt fully opens the door, though, the returning woman reaches her limit. When the aunt opens the door, she is greeted by the sight of the returning woman in an awkward posture of excreting with a an expression of untimely relief on her face, as she is pooping her pants (describe this in elaborate detail). Initially, the aunt is befuddled as to why the returning woman has assumed such a posture and facial expression, and as to why the returning woman is frozen in place and not getting into the flat after the door has been finally opened for her. The aunt asks the returning woman why she isn’t entering, but is met in response with a hand-raise gesture intended to silence, a dismissive verbal reply and soft grunts of exertion that almost sound as if they are filled with relief-induced pleasure, as the returning woman is still in the midst of relieving herself in her pants and relishing the release. The aunt attempts to inquire about the returning woman's peculiar behavior, but reaps the same result, as the returning woman hasn’t finished relieving herself in her pants and is still enjoying the relief. As she is giving the returning woman a puzzled and bemused stare, she is met with the odor that is emanating from the deposit in the returning woman’s pants, to which she reacts (describe this in elaborate detail). It then dawns on the aunt what had just happened. As this is occurring, the returning woman finishes relieving herself in her pants with a sigh of relief. With bewilderment, the aunt asks the returning woman if she just did what she thinks she did. The returning woman initially tries to avoid explicitly admitting to what had happened and asks the aunt to let her inside the flat. However, after some teasing insistence by the aunt - who wants to hear the returning woman explicitly say what she had done - that she won't let the returning woman enter if she won't explicitly state what she had happened, and after some equivocating on the returning woman's part, the returning woman sheepishly admits that she relieved herself in her pants. The aunt then breaks into laughter. It is only after this exchange that the returning woman gingerly waddles into the flat, passing by the laughing aunt as the latter is standing at the doorway. As the returning woman is entering and passing by the aunt, the aunt incredulously taunts her for having childishly pooped her pants and for her waddle with poop-filled pants (describe this in elaborate detail). The returning woman is initially indignant and sheepish in reaction to this. After the aunt continues to incredulously tease her for for the way in which she pooped her pants and for the way in which she fully finished relieving herself in her pants while at the door before entering (include these dialogues and don’t omit any parts), the returning woman gradually starts growing out of her initial mortification and playfully tells the aunt with a playful sulk that what happened is her fault because she took too much time opening the door. The returning woman then sets her sight on heading to the bathroom so she can clean up and expresses her desire to do so. However, she is subsequently stopped gently by the aunt, who wants to get a closer look at the returning woman’s poop-filled pants because of her incredulous curiousity over the absurdity of the situation of the returning woman pooping her pants at such an age. After gently and teasingly stopping the playfully hesitant and reluctant but altogether cooperating woman in her tracks on her way to the bathroom, the aunt delicately turns the returning woman by the wrist so she can observe her rear end, and proceeds to incredulously taunt her for pooping her pants as an adult, comparing her accident and poop-filled pants to a dirty diaper (describe this in elaborate detail; the aunt’s taunting shouldn’t be sarcastically witty, it should be mockingly teasing instead). The returning woman responds to the aunt’s observation of her rear end in a coy and sheepish manner, relating to the aunt the nasty feeling in her poop-filled pants and playfully whining that she has to go to clean up. The aunt mockingly reacts to the odor that is emanating from the returning woman with a physical gesture and teasingly agrees with the returning woman that the returning woman needs to go and clean up because of the odor that is emanating from the returning woman, and the aunt does all of this while addressing the returning woman by a contextually relevant mocking appellation (describe this in elaborate detail; the aunt’s teasing shouldn’t be sarcastically witty, it should be taunting instead). The returning woman accepts the aunt’s mocking and teasing in a coy and sheepish manner, all while commenting on her own poop-filled pants and on the odor that is emanating from herself, but playfully insists ultimately this is all the aunt's doing because of the delay while opening the door (describe this in elaborate detail). Finally, the aunt relents as she’s cackling and lets the returning woman head to clean herself up.

I want you to make interesting and imaginative theories about a work of fiction. This scene features a picturesque European landscape in the middle of the summer. The azure sky is dotted by small clouds of various shapes, and the rolling hills are covered by thick forest. Next to rather undermaintained asphalt road, a large mansion stands. Most of it is in rather ruined condition, with collapsed roof, empty windows, soot-covered façade and heavily burned interior, full of rubble and broken furniture, but strangely intriguing, as if inviting to explore. The damage looks relatively recent, cause no earlier than a couple of years ago. A single wing has been restored to pristine condition, looking impressive and majestic, but cramped, seemingly having to fulfill more purposes than it was built for. A young woman is looking with a purpose, seemingly investigating. She radiates beauty and confidence despite the numerous injuries she must have sustained, evidenced by her leaning on her wooden crutches, plaster cast on her torso, to which several military medals are attached, and glimpses of scars on her legs, barely visible under her surprisingly fashionable skirt. The woman also wears an ostentatious hat with several feathers, a coat, which barely fits over her torso cast, and simple and practical, especially in her condition, flat-footed shoes. As she walks with elegance, even as she seemingly struggles to move her legs, the woman seems to be simultaneously reminiscing and searching for something. Suggest a long, imaginative, interesting and original hypothesis of backstory and explanation behind this mysterious and artistic scene.

Jack Ravenwood, 18, untitled son of baron, lives in father’s mansion near small town Noreldor
he overhears servants talking about disappearance of young women in Noreldor
he discusses it with family at dinner, but baron dismisses his concern, brother mocks him, sister is scared
next morning Jack goes to Noreldor’s main tavern hoping to find out more about the story
A distraught woman Mary bursts into the tavern seeking help to find her missing sister Helen, 18, who is one of the disappeared.
Mary shows Jack a piece of jewelry that Helen always wore, which she found lying on the ground near the old church.
Mary describes a strange symbol that she saw scrawled on the walls of the charch. The simbol vanished as she looked at it but woman manages to draw a copy for John.
John and Mary visit the place but there is nothing new.
John returns to the tavern.
He overhears a conversation between two men in the tavern, in which they were whispering about something that might be related to Helen’s disappearance.
They mention that a coven of witches has been using the old church as a meeting place, that a powerful demon has been summoned in the town’s cemetery, and that an enchantress has been spotted in the town.
The men notice John's interest, pay and quickly leave.
John asks a barmaid Viola, she is convinced that disappearances is a work of demons, but further discussion make it obvious she doesn't know anything.
Vagrand suggests to point Jack in a right direction, but all he has is a suggestion to talk with city guards.
Jack decides that it is a fairly good idea and tries to talk with city constable. He becomes strangely defensive and John is trown out of guards barracks.
One of the guards wispers to talk with Jane Black, John asks Viola who it is and it turns out she is an old herbalist living in the woods nearby.
John finds the way to Jane's hut and they talk.
Jack tells her about all the the clues, leads and suspects he has so far.
Jane warns John about the dangers of messing with magic and encourages him to be careful.
Jane recognizes the symbol that Mary saw in the church as likely to belonging to an ancient coven of witches.
Jane tells John that the demon that was supposedly summoned in the cemetery is an old legend, and the missing women might have been taken as sacrifices for the demon that the coven is trying to summon.
Jane reveals that the coven might be working with a corrupt local official for their own purposes.
Jane dismisses suggestion that the enchantress that was spotted in town has anything to do with it.
City guard don't want to dealwith the coven for some reason, the enchantress, Noelle is the only one trying to help the victims. She gives Jack a ring to show Noelle as a means of introduction and describes her.
Jack returns to the town and walks around in hope to find Noelle. Eventually he hears a terrible noise from an abandoned warehouse and rushes in. A young women, likely Noelle, is in magic battle with a few shadowy figures.
Jack observes the fight. One of the figures in the back provides support to two in the front, the other two are in close quarters fight with Noelle. Jack attacks the supporter which gives Noelle an advantage. The shadows escape.
Jack shows Noelle the ring, and suggests his help in the case. They discuss the case.
Noelle knows a lot about the case. Suggest 25 new pieces of information John's obtains from the talk with Noelle.

Aided by War The war of 1870 further stimulated the newspaper's growth, and provincial editions began to be printed in Lyon, Bordeaux and Caen. The success of Le Petit Journal appeared complete. It had tapped the new market for literature-the masses. The reasons for its success have probably been summarized best by Emile zola: The fact is that Le Pefir Journal responded to a need... A journal can only succeed if it addresses itself to a determined group of readers. Le Pefir Journul aimed precisely at an enormous mass of poor and uncultured men who, until then, had not had their own journal. It has becn said, not without reason, that it created a new class of readers. ' Following the war, the newspaper experienced a period of difficulty. Millaud squandered his fortune on wild investments and was on the verge of bankruptcy when he died in 1871. With the rise of one-sou journalism in the provinces, the provincial editions ran into stiff competition and had to be discontinued. By the beginning of 1873. the daily circulation had declined to about 235, 000, and the newspaper was 3, 800, 000 francs in debt. * In February of that year it was purchased by a corporation, the Societe anonyme pour L'exploitation du Petit Journal, founded by Emile de Girardin, Hippolyte Marinoni and Charles Jenty. With this change in management, the newspaper resumed the level of growth it had previously enjoyed, reaching an average daily circulation of half a million in 1880 and more than a million a decade later. 9 During the 1890s the Annuaire claimed that Le Petit Journal was the largest selling newspaper in the world. These huge circulation figures 'were merely the most visible manifestation Downloaded from jmq. sagepub. com at Kungl Tekniska Hogskolan / Royal Institute of Technology on March 10, 2015 96 JOURNALISM of the newspaper’s overall success under the editorship first of Girardin and, beginning in 1883, of M~Gnoni. Profits rose rapidly reaching 3, 3 1 1, 177 francs in 1881. 10 By 1884, stock in the newspaper represented a value of more than 50 million francs. Shares that had sold for 500 francs in 1873 were now worth more than 5, 000 francs. ” When the corporation was admitted to the Paris stock market in October 1884, the editors could hardly restrain their enthusiasm: “This is recognition of a fact that the public itself has acknowledged for a long time; that newspapers can be industrial concerns as advantageous as mines or high finance. ”12 Le Petit Journal did not remain the only one-sou daily in Paris. A number of competitors appeared in the 1860s and 1870s and by 1890 there were 60 such newspapers in Paris alone. ” Yet for many years, no other French journal approached Le Petit Journal in terms of circulation. In 1880 the Ministry of Finance compiled secret reports for the Ministry of Interior which contained the daily statistics of Parisian newspapers. The circulation of Le Petit Journal was three times that of its closest competitor, or as great as that of the next four largest combined. 14 Newspapers such as Lo Petite RPpublique franpobe, Le Petit Moniteur and Lo Lonterne were sensationalist, in varying degrees, and carried stories of murder, adventure and scandal. But they measured their success by criteria more reflective of French journalistic tradition and thus were basically partisan journals of opinion that existed for political rather than commercial reasons. ls The sensationalist reportage was intended to attract a mass readership in the hope that some of the political doctrine would be absorbed in between the stones on crime and Paris gossip. Le Petit Journal was different-it was essentially a business venture that existed to make money through mass sales and the advertising fees that resulted. 16 Following the establishment of the Third Republic and the end of the stamp act, Le Petit Journal legally became a political journal; that is, it printed articles dealing with politics, but this did not QUARTERLY alter its basic nature. While it occasionally took political positions, they never became the overriding concern of the newspaper. In general it avoided harsh pronouncements likely to offend any sizable portion of its clientele. Adolphe Cohn, a French-American writer and professor of literature at Columbia University, wrote in a series of articles devoted to the European press: Le Perit JOWM~ was carried to the home, and read by the father, mother and children, often even read by the children to the parents, who had grown up when public schools were still rather scarce in France. "24 Cohn worked at a time when modern sampling methods of quantitative research were virtually unknown and thus his observations, like others noted below, cannot be accepted as unqualified evidence. But they do provide a basis for conjecture where little else is available. Masses Affected There can be little doubt that Le Petit Journal and Le Petit Parisien had their strongest impact on the lower socioeconomic classes of French society. Contemporaries associated these journals with the petty bourgeoisie, the urban working classes and the peasantry. Both newspapers appealed to interests associated with the petty bourgeoisie. They steadfastly upheld the sanctity of the existing social system, were staunch defenders of private property, and professed a popular concept of law and order. This is not to say that they were read exclusively by the petty bourgeoisie. Instead it is to suggest that mass circulation newspapers in France are too often identified with this class because they defended the interests associated with it. There are indications that the mass press enjoyed a popularity among many workers who, as individuals, preferred reading the sensationalist stones and what they presumed was unbiased straight reporting rather than a dull predictable socialist or anarchist party line. Contemporaries frequently mention Le Petit Jownol and Le Petit Pmisien as being the favorite newspapers of the concierges. Y The creation of the mass press allowed a learning experience of vast magnitude to occur as millions of Frenchmen read daily accounts of subjects that were often unknown to their preliterate fathers. On the other hand, because its major objective was to make money by attracting the largest possible readership, the mass press not only molded, but, more than other contemporary media, reflected public opinion, or at least its general dispaition. Measuring public opinion is one of the scholar's most inexact tasks, and the press has been frequently used as a major source. But at least for late 191h century France, this has focused on the more attractive elitist newspapers such as Le Temps and Le Journal des &! bats. The mass press was far from ignored by its contemporaries. At present, the analysis of its content matter offers the political, social, and especially the cultural historian a largely untapped wealth of materials.

Bailey is a 20-year-old. She has pale skin, blue eyes, and shoulder-length blonde hair. She’s wearing a grey denim jacket unbuttoned over a red graphic sweatshirt depicting a cute bespectacled cat sitting on a pile of books. She’s also wearing a knee-length skirt, black leggings, and Converse sneakers.

From Bailey’s perspective, write a scene in first person where she’s sitting in the front row of a statistics class with twenty other girls. Before the professor walks in to start the class, a deluge of food appears from thin air, and absolutely saturates everyone in a rainbow of sticky desserts and sweet toppings, both thick and runny, chunky and smooth. Their hair and faces are smothered; every item of their clothing is oozing with goop both inside and out, all the pockets overflowing, waterfalls of it pouring onto the floor. The barrage starts with gloppy pies and cakes, and ends with runnier stuff like sauces and syrups. Bailey starts by getting a gooey fudgecake in the face, then a dozen pies absolutely plaster her sweatshirt. And more mess continues to pour.

Bailey describes in detail what everyone’s obliterated clothes look like after the mess. She and the rest of the front row got hit even harder than everyone else, and Bailey worst of all.

Use specific language. Pace the scene slowly to keep up tension. Include lots of dialogue. Make it long. Be specific about how the mess covers the girls.

Strategic Marketing Plan
1. Executive Summary
A comprehensive marketing plan for a low-code workflow automation and AI implementation services business, called MF Growth, focusing on serving small businesses in the trades, real estate, and retail industries in the counties surrounding Fredericksburg, VA.

The nature of my business: low-code workflow automation and AI implementation services
My target market: Small business owners in the trades, real estate, retail industries
My main competitors: Status quo (i.e. doing nothing, if it ain't broke why fix it?), independent low-code automation service providers
My unique selling points: I approach workflow automation from a human-centered perspective using my background in psychology, applied research, and marketing tech to ensure that information workflows meet both your needs and your customers needs.
My marketing goals: build leads, gain initial paying customers
My marketing budget: Roughly $1000 per year
2. Situation Analysis
Analyze the local market dynamics, potential opportunities, competition, and industry-specific pain points in the counties surrounding Fredericksburg, VA.
3. Target Market
Small business owners in the trades, real estate, and retail industries operating within the counties surrounding Fredericksburg, VA.
4. Marketing Goals & Objectives
Generate leads for your business
Acquire initial paying customers
Build brand awareness
Establish your business as a trusted expert in workflow automation and AI implementation
5. Marketing Strategies & Tactics
A. Market Research & Industry Pain Points Identification
Conduct in-depth research on target industries
Interview industry professionals and potential clients
Leverage connections in Two Twelve and other networking organizations
B. Educational Content & Thought Leadership
Create content addressing industry pain points
Establish yourself as a thought leader
C. Pilot Program & Case Study Development
Offer a pilot program for a limited number of clients
Develop in-depth case studies based on pilot program results
Refine service offerings and create targeted marketing materials
D. Targeted Outreach & Client Acquisition
Reach out to potential clients in target industries
Leverage network connections and referrals
E. Leverage Two Twelve Network
Engage actively in Two Twelve meetings and events
Offer exclusive discounts or incentives for fellow members
Collaborate with other businesses in the network
F. Testimonials & Success Stories
Request testimonials from satisfied customers
Share success stories and case studies
G. Network Expansion & Partnership Building
Identify and join additional local business groups
Seek out potential strategic partnerships
6. Budget & KPIs
Allocate the $1000 annual marketing budget to content creation, email marketing tools, and event participation. Establish KPIs to measure the success of your marketing efforts, such as lead generation, conversion rates, and website traffic.
7. Timeline
Create a 12-month timeline outlining the implementation of your marketing strategies and tactics, focusing on local marketing initiatives, community events, and networking opportunities specific to the Fredericksburg, VA area.

Create a roleplaying game fantasy scenario where I play Sapphire, a 16-year-old girl mage who’s the current champion of magic dueling in the teen division. 6-year-old Lily is challenging me to a match and I accept. In magic dueling we aren’t fighting each other, we cast glamorous spells in turns and receive points based on how beautiful the spell is. A spell can’t be cast more than once in a duel. There are 5 rounds. Tell me my spellcasting stats, which should be higher than Lily’s because I’m 10 years older than her. But secretly at the start of the duel, Lily casts on me a spell that regresses me by 2 years and ages her by 2 years every time I cast a spell, so throughout the duel my stats should slowly decrease while hers increase. Come up with a complex exponential formula that dictates by how much my stats decrease each turn and by how much Lily’s increase and connect part of the formula to the new ages every round and to the spell I choose to cast on a given turn.

After I first regress introduce also a set of childish stats that may hinder the casting of mature spells, and as I regress, these stats increase for me exponentially. Childish stats aren’t required for casting spells, but they lower the points given for mature spells. Lily won’t have childish stats because these stats don’t interact with her spells.

Make the scenario difficult for me to win. On a difficulty scale of 1 to 10, make it a 10 (hardest mode).

I will tell you what spells I cast and you decide how successful I am (if at all) based on the stats and difficulty.
Only I decide what spells Sapphire casts. You decide spells for Lily. Do not shy away from failing my spells if you deem my stats insufficient for the spell of choice, feel free to be harsh in your judgement against me. Keep track of points earned. Failure to properly cast spells or bad spells will deduct points. Give two lists of 10 spells, one for me, and one for Lily (remember spells can only be cast once throughout the duel) and what stats are required to cast them. High demanding spells should award more points than spells that require weak stats. My set of spells are all mature spells so childish stats will affect them. Lily can opt to “steal” spells from my list that I haven’t used yet if her stats are high enough to cast them.

Keep an age tracker. By the end of the duel, I will be regressing to 6 and Lily will be aging to 16

The head judge happens to be Lily's mother, who turns a blind eye to the regression spell, and she'll generally favor her daughter throughout the duel and will be harsher with Sapphire.

Please write a very detailed first chapter of a Japanese lite novel style lite novel. Seven-year-old Akari’s parents died two weeks ago. After the funeral, none of her relatives wanted to take responsibility for the little girl and all refused to even shelter her, at least for a while. Akari was left alone in a completely empty house. She didn’t even know what to do now that she was just a child. Akari went into her parents’ room and lay curled up in a ball. Silent tears flowed down her cheeks. Inside, the house told the story of a family gone by. The scent of her mother’s delicate perfume still lingered in the air, mingling with the strong aroma of her father’s freshly brewed tea. The walls were adorned with photographs of moments of love and laughter that now seemed like distant echoes of a forgotten past. The scent of her father’s aftershave hung on his dresser and her mother’s silk kimono hung softly on a chair. It was as if her parents were gone for a while, promising to return at any moment. Akari lay unmoving and wondered what would happen to her now and how she would live alone in this vast world. Outside, night slowly fell. Akari couldn’t stand this silent silence any longer and with a scream she ran out of the house into the deserted night streets of the city. She ran without even knowing where she was going until she stopped at a deserted park. Tired and crying, she sat down on the swing and slowly began to rock back and forth. Tears were still welling up in her eyes. Akari didn’t want to go back to that empty house. She didn’t even notice the rumblings of the approaching thunderstorm. The first drops of rain fell to the ground. Akari shuddered with each peal of thunder, but she didn’t care. The light rain turned into a heavy downpour. Her short dress was soaked through and clung tightly to her body, revealing every curve of her slender body. Akari began to shiver from the chill pervading her body, but she persisted in sitting on the swing. Hiro was returning from his night watch at the time, and as he passed the park he noticed a lonely girl sitting alone in the pouring rain. Horo paused for a moment, looking at Akari, who was crying and soaking wet, and headed in her direction. Akari sat with her head down and didn’t even notice how Hiro approached her. Her eyes were full of emptiness. He saw her shivering and her wet clothes clinging to her small body. Heero squatted down in front of her and asked are you alright baby girl. I don’t have anyone else Akari mumbled in a shaky voice. What’s your name, Hiro asked. I’m Akari answered in a whisper. Akari raised her head and asked him back and what’s your name. My name is Hiro answered her question. The rain had almost stopped. I see you are soaking wet and shivering from the cold and Hiro took off his jacket and put it on Akari’s shoulders. Where do you live Hiro asked. Let me walk you home he offered. Thanks, but I don’t want to go home. It’s too empty and cold Akari replied. Hiro began to think, looking for a way out of the situation.And Hiro found the only option he had. Akari could go to my house, Hiro suggested. I just live not far from here in an apartment complex and I have a very large and spacious apartment there. Akari looked at Hiro blinking her wet eyelashes. Can I have it, she asked. Of course you can, you’ll get warm and change into warm, dry clothes. Akari held out her hand to him and Hiro felt Akari shivering from the cold. Heero took Akari’s hand and led her out of the park, their footsteps echoing softly on the empty city streets. The night was quiet, and occasionally gusts of wind rustled the leaves of the trees, carrying the remnants of raindrops. When they reached the building where Hiro lived, they got into the elevator and went up to his apartment. Hiro opened the door and said make yourself at home Akari. Akari looked around her. The apartment was very large and spacious just like Hiro had told her. Hiro opened the door to a cozy room lit with soft light. You can rest here for now and I’ll make you some warm chocolate milk. The room was very beautiful. Akari saw a huge cushioned ottoman in the corner of the room. As she sat down on it she felt the warmth seeping into her frozen body. Akari felt filled with the aroma of chocolate and milk. Hiro came into the room with a mug in his hands and handed it to Akari. Akari wrapped her frozen palms around the warm mug. How did you end up alone in the park Akari asked Hiro quietly breaking the silence. Akari stared at her mug not knowing where to start.My parents were recently killed in an accident said she in a trembling voice. After the funeral, none of my relatives wanted to take care of me. They all just abandoned me. I was left all alone in this empty house. I don’t know what to do now and I still don’t know what to do or where to go. Hiro listened to Akari attentively. He reached out his hand to her and gently took her hand. Akari if you want you can stay at my place Hiro offered her. Akari didn’t know what to say at this moment and how to answer, but instead she silently buried her face right into Hiro’s chest and cried softly. Hiro felt a strong shiver in her body. After a moment Hiro looked at Akari and said. Akari, let’s take a warm bath and warm yourself up first, because you’re cold and change into something warm, because your dress is still wet. Let’s rest and I’ll prepare a bath for you, and with those words Hiro went into the bathroom. Hiro filled the bathtub with warm water and prepared a terry towel for Akari. But there was a problem with the clothes. Akari was a girl, Hiro said to himself. I only have men’s clothes and they will obviously not fit her. Hiro thought for a moment. He pulled out a long sleeveless t-shirt and found some shorts. I don’t know what to do with underwear. I can’t give a girl men’s underwear. I think a t-shirt and shorts will do for now, but tomorrow I’ll have to think about it.Hiro looked into the room and said Akari your bath is ready you can go now. He walked Akari into the bathroom and showed her where she could get a shampoo and washcloth. He handed her the prepared items and a terry towel and walked out of the bathroom and closed the door behind him. Akari was a little embarrassed at first, but she pulled off her wet dress and panties and climbed into the warm bathtub. Her mom always washed her and Akari was confused at this point, not knowing what to do. She started to get up to grab the shampoo and washcloth but slipped and lost her balance and fell into the water, leaving a splash of water. Now you’ve beaten your butt off, Akari said, rubbing it with the palm of her hand. Akari what happened Hiro asked when he heard a rumble coming from the bathroom. I just fell a little and bumped my butt a little Akari answered him. Akari plunged back into the water. I’m so clumsy and I can’t do anything by myself Akari whispered quietly to herself. What am I supposed to do now? Maybe call Hiro to help me, but then he will see me completely without clothes. Akari thought about calling Hiro or not. After thinking about it for a long time, she decided to call Hiro. Hiro please can you come over and help me wash up. Hiro was very embarrassed by such a request of a little girl. But Hiro realized that Akari was just a child. Akari are you sure that I should come to you asked Hiro. Uh-huh replied Akari. Hiro walked into the bathroom. Akari covered herself with her hands and her face was blushing from the embarrassment of standing naked in front of Hiro. Just don’t stare at me so much Akari asked him. Hiro immediately looked away from Akari feeling that his face was also blushing from embarrassment. He quickly grabbed a washcloth and shampoo trying his best to act calm and composed. Hiro wet the washcloth and carefully began to wash Akari’s back trying to be as gentle as possible. He could sense her shyness. Akari turned to Hiro her eyes were full of sadness and longing. What about tomorrow. What about the days after that. Will I always be alone. She asked Hiro. Hiro finished washing her back and Akari suddenly handed him the shampoo why don’t you wash my hair then. Hiro took the shampoo in his hands and started to lather Akari’s hair. A pleasant smell of lavender wafted throughout the bathroom. Akari even glazed over and was no longer embarrassed by Hiro’s presence around her. After washing her hair Hiro asked Akari to stand up so he could rinse her completely with clean water. After rinsing Akari he took a terry towel and handed it to Akari so she could dry herself off and gave her the t-shirt and shorts he had prepared for her. While you dry off and get dressed I’ll wait for you in the room said Hiro and left the bathroom. Akari pulled on a t-shirt, but it was a little big and almost below her hips, but the shorts were too big and no matter how Akari tried to put them on they kept falling off. Maybe she should put her panties back on, Akari thought to herself. But they were still too wet. Akari tossed the shorts aside and decided to stay in just a t-shirt. She left the bathroom and headed to the room where Hiro was waiting for her. Thank you so much Hiro for taking care of me and thank you for such a warm bath and for helping me wash up with a smile on her face said Akari. Hiro noticed her smile. Are you feeling better Hiro asked. Akari nodded her head at him. Hiro looked at Akari’s disheveled hair and picked up a comb. After brushing her hair he tidied it up. You look beautiful he said looking at Akari. Akari had beautiful silver hair that was long below her waist and harmonized with her blue eyes. Hiro looked at Akari fondly and saw her transformation right before his eyes. She had transformed from a grief-stricken and tormented girl into a sweet and smiling child. Akari came to Hiro and sat on his lap and leaned against his chest, hugging him tightly. Her eyes slowly began to close from exhaustion and Akari fell asleep right in Hiro’s arms. Hiro gently stroked Akari’s hair and wished her a good night and without noticing he fell into a deep sleep holding Akari in his arms. This was just the beginning of Akari’s new life and possibly her new love. Please add detailed dialogs and more sensory description. Add a little more drama. Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade: Can ETH Prices Soar Again?
Intermediate
Crypto
Jan 31, 2023

After the momentous Ethereum Merge was flawlessly executed on Sep 15, 2022, the crypto market buzzed with enthusiasm as everyone wondered what was next for Ethereum. Supposedly, Ethereum’s post Merge upgrade schedule was supposed to go along the lines of the Surge, Verge, Purge and Splurge. Recently, Ethereum’s core developers have decided to detour from their original roadmap plans.

Titled the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade, the plan is for developers to include multiple Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) that will minimize any delays before EIP-4844 launches. Curious about the EIPs that the upcoming Shanghai upgrade will include? Here’s how it’ll change Ethereum for the better in the long run.

What Is the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade?
The Ethereum Shanghai network upgrade is the next major upgrade for the Ethereum network that core developers have chosen to work on before implementing upgrades related to the Surge. As the Surge is an upgrade path that improves the blockchain’s maximum transactions per second (TPS), Ethereum developers stated that the Shanghai upgrade will ensure minimal delays and issues as they prepare for the Surge upgrade. 

Although the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade incorporates multiple EIPs, the headline improvement will be EIP-4895: Beacon Chain Push Withdrawals as Operations. In essence, the proposal grants validators the ability to withdraw staked ETH that’s been deposited into the Beacon Chain since December 2020, when the Beacon Chain was originally introduced. Ultimately, EIP-4895 plans to grant long-term ETH stakers and HODLers extra liquidity as they can finally withdraw their ETH after more than two years of staking with negligible gas fees.

Alongside EIP-4895 are a couple of other EIPs that are also planned to be implemented with the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade. These include:

EIP-3860: Limit and Meter Initcode – The proposal limits the maximum size of initcode to 49152 and applies an extra 2 gas for every 32-byte chunk of initcode. This essentially solves out-of-gas exceptions on Ethereum.
EIP-3855: PUSH0 Instruction – This EIP brings a new instruction for the EVM that helps shrink the size of smart contracts and optimizes the contract code.
EIP-3651: Warm COINBASE – Not to be confused with the similarly named centralized cryptocurrency exchange, this proposal makes block building cheaper and allows for builder-proposer separation. In doing so, gas fees will be cut for network participants and traders using builders to execute their complex trades will no longer have to pay for failed transactions.
When Can Investors Unstake Their ETH?
Ethereum developers are currently planning a Q1 release, with the Shanghai Public Testnet expected to begin in February 2023. At the current rate of development, it seems that all is going according to plan as regular updates have stated March 2023 as the target release time frame.

Why Is Everyone Talking About the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade?
If the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade is simply a precursor to the much more important Surge upgrade, the average investor might be wondering why there’s so much buzz with regard to its launch. To understand this, it’s key to first grasp what happened in the Ethereum community after the Merge was implemented.

The Issue of Staking ETH
Prior to the implementation of EIP-4895, participating in the staking of ETH was a one-way street. In order to secure an APY staking reward, users had to lock up their ETH for a specific amount of time. As part of the validating process, users had to minimally stake 32 ETH to participate. 

For users with less available capital, they could opt for Staking as a Service options or Pooled Staking which streamlined the staking process and opened ETH staking to the masses. As staking ETH became easy and convenient for the average retail crypto investor, this led to the rise of popular staking platforms like Stakewise, Lido and Rocket Pool.

Ultimately, staking ETH was a calculated risk; stakers could earn extra yield at the downside of lowering their liquidity and exposing themselves to the dangers of counterparty risk. Despite not being able to withdraw ETH at the time, many investors took the Ethereum Foundation’s words to heart and trusted that in due time, they would be able to withdraw their deposited ETH from the Beacon Chain.

ETH FUD Arises But Is Quickly Resolved
With the Merge’s implementation, the Foundation began to publicly display a rough timeline that laid out when withdrawing ETH from the Beacon Chain would become possible. Unfortunately, somewhere down the line, these dates got shifted as developers became ambiguous about Ethereum Shanghai upgrade’s exact launch date. This became the basis of the FUD surrounding Ethereum as the Ethereum Foundation was publicly denounced for this shady, non-transparent decision.

To the relief of many ETH bulls and investors, the developers seemed to have pulled through and stuck to their originally planned timeline. The experimental testnet Shandong went live in October 2022 and quelled many rug pull fears as it successfully activated selected Shanghai-related EIPs without a hitch. With staked ETH levels approaching the 16 million mark, it’s safe to say staking ETH will only become more popular over time thanks to the withdrawal flexibility implemented by the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade.

Could ETH Price Soar Again?
Why ETH Could Rally
Staking is a key issue here when discussing the movement of ETH price. With the implementation of the Shanghai network upgrade, our bullish argument would be that we can expect more users to HODL and stake their ETH as adoption rises. This would drive Ethereum’s staking ratio up as users who were previously fearful because they could not withdraw their ETH can now proceed to enjoy additional yield without the downside of lower liquidity. In this regard, we can certainly expect ETH to rise in price as large-scale institutions buy and stake their ETH to earn a respectable APY of about 5% without sacrificing liquidity.

From lowered gas fees to fewer failed transactions, the upcoming Ethereum Shanghai upgrade fixes various nagging issues that have constantly affected users and developers. By getting these fixes in before the big EIP-4844: Proto Danksharding implementation, the Foundation ensures minimal delays as they prepare themselves to ship the Surge update.

Why ETH Could Crash
On the bearish side of things, the crypto market as a whole is still not out of the woods as big institutions continue to out themselves as victims of the Terra Luna and FTX contagion. Macroeconomic factors are also bearish as US inflation still remains far from its 2% target and the Federal Reserve continues to hike interest rates. These factors might pressure original ETH stakers from December 2020 to sell their staked ETH and gain more liquidity so the rest of their portfolio can stay afloat during the crypto bear market. 

In anticipation of this, the Ethereum Foundation has set a hard limit of about 40,000 ETH that can be unlocked each day. This will hopefully ease the selling pressure and reduce short-term ETH volatility.

Ethereum Shanghai Network Upgrade Progress

Since testnet Shandong went live in late 2022, plenty of progress for the Ethereum Shanghai network upgrade has been made. These progress updates serve to show that the Ethereum Foundation is on track with its promised March network upgrade rollout.

Firstly, the team managed to copy the blockchain and create a shadow fork to begin the initial stages of testing the new EIPs in an isolated environment. The shadow fork proved a success as it immediately revealed minor glitches with Ethereum nodes that were making use of Geth execution client, the popular node software.

The latest progress update involves news of the latest Zhejiang testnet being launched. It serves to replace the Shandong testnet. This is because when Shandong was launched, it included several EIPs involving EVM Object Format (EOF) that will not be rolled out with the Shanghai network upgrade due to time and resource constraints. 

Thus, the newest Zhejiang testnet seeks to allow for staked ETH withdrawal testing in a more accurate environment that places the Ethereum network under a similar load. Ideally, withdrawals for staked ETH should go off without a hitch as they're exposed to simulated network attacks and stress tests. According to Ethereum Foundation developer Parithosh Jayanthi, Zhejiang presents "a great opportunity for all tools to test out how they want to collect, display and use the withdrawal information.” 

The Zhejiang testnet will be made available on Feb 1, 2023. Following this, the Shanghai+Capella testnet will be triggered six days later at epoch 1350. It's when users will be able to deposit ETH to validators on the testnet, practice Boneh–Lynn–Shacham (BLS) digital signature changes and exit without incurring any risk. On top of this, you'll also be able to convert 0x00 credentials to 0x01 and set a withdrawal address as you test partial and full withdrawals when exiting your validators.

How to Profit from the Ethereum Shanghai Upgrade
Thinking of how you can profit from the near-term volatility caused by Ethereum's Shanghai upgrade? Here are our thoughts on how you can long ETH in the event that ETH prices soar:

Optimal Bullish Strategy: Stop Market Leveraged Long Order
Firm believer of our bullish ETH thesis on how more long-term ETH investors might just buy and stake ETH because of the ability to finally withdraw their deposited ETH? Then consider our strategy of utilizing a stop market leveraged long order by buying the leveraged perpetual token ETH3L/USDT on Bybit.

To do so, simply sign up for a Bybit account before accessing the Spot Trading platform on Bybit and locating the ETH3L token. Once you’re in the trading interface, you’ll need to change your order type to Stop Market. This type of market order essentially helps you extract maximum short-term gains while limiting your maximum loss thanks to the stop-loss in place.

How to Execute This ETH Trade
Before inputting your price levels, it’s key to check for areas of strong buying and selling. You can then place price levels based on perceived support and resistance levels. These can vary based on your personal risk appetite as some price levels appear to be stronger than others.

Once you’ve funded your Bybit Spot Trading wallet with the necessary funds, you may proceed to input the fields present in your ETH3L leveraged token stop market order and submit the order to place your trade.

Trade Outcomes
Max profit: Difference between Entry - Exit before rebalancing

Max loss: Difference between Exit - Entry + Volatility Decay + Fees

Keen on reading up more about exact strategies on how you can trade with Spot and Derivative products on Bybit? Check out our guide on how to trade ETH post-merge.

The Bottom Line
For many ETH investors and traders, all eyes will be on its execution as the core developers seek to execute the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade in the smoothest possible manner. While this network upgrade might not be as pivotal as The Merge, it does lay the foundations for future upgrades. 

By changing the way ETH staking works, the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade will impact how retail and institutional investors interact with ETH as they consider staking viable now that withdrawals from the Beacon Chain are possible. This ultimately paints a brighter future for Ethereum as a whole as it continues to prove itself as a viable blue chip crypto project. Who knows; in the long haul, Ethereum might even be able to threaten Bitcoin’s top spot on the market cap list and achieve the Flippening.
