Case Study:

Career Training is a private registered training organisation (RTO) based in Geraldton, Western Australia.  Career Training is recognised as an industry training leader delivering nationally recognised and specialised courses. Registered training organisations (RTOs) are the training providers registered by ASQA (or, in some cases, a state regulator) to deliver nationally recognised vocational education and training (VET) services.

Career Training provides qualifications in various subject areas, including business, community services, information technology and hospitality. There are currently 400 students enrolled across a wide range of courses. There are 35 staff members, including training staff and administration.

 The levels of qualifications provided are as follows:

Certificates I, II, III and IV
Diploma
Advanced Diploma
Career Training follows the important standards of the industry and focusses on supporting informed decisions, engagement and participation. The RTO applies a systematic approach to ensure quality across all training and assessment services, including staff and systems.  It seeks feedback from students and internal staff every month and conducts internal audits of the company’s policies and procedures to ensure compliance against the standards for registered training organisations.

Mission

Career Training aims to provide the highest quality and research-based vocational business education and facilitate a conducive environment to develop the global mindsets of students

Vision

To become Australia’s leading academy of business and develop well-equipped world’s leaders

Values

Providing a respectful and safe environment for all staff and students.
Integrity, transparency and accountability in work styles.
Fostering an inclusive learning environment for all students
Continuous improvement based on regular feedback from students and the community
Integrating principles of equity and non - discrimination.
Context of the Assessment

Management aims at exploring new marketing opportunities to enhance business growth by promoting courses in Business.

Career Training embraced a review of their present marketing strategies and found various things, including:

The market situation had changed, and the competition had evolved.
The target market characteristics had segmented further with globalisation.
The digital space and media preferences of their market had evolved.
The organisational requirements had become more complicated due to introducing new courses.
Presently, Career training is marketing their courses based on students’ references and word of mouth only. Due to this, marketing outcomes have not been satisfactory. Therefore, Career training is planning to implement new opportunities to promote the business courses.

Strategic objectives for marketing initiatives

To ensure the consistent and positive brand message for the RTO
To increase the enrolments by 10% annually
To promote the new courses through a marketing communication campaign.
To grow brand awareness and market share by 10% by the end of financial year.
Excerpts from the Career Training - Marketing plan (This can be viewed in full on the Career Training Website using the log in details above)

The marketing strategy of Career Training is the annual production and distribution of brochures containing detailed information about courses. There is focus on market penetration and product development. Career training also aims to organise promotional events for students, education agents, and other digital marketing to get more leads and make a brand.

Marketing prospects

Market segmentation
New market development
Promotional events
Upgrading of skills of human resources
Product development
Product diversification
Target audience

Characteristics:

Existing students, students who keep making enquiries of new courses or friends/relatives of existing students.
Students aged 18-25 years
Technology savvy young students
 

SWOT Analysis Completed:

Strength

•      Commitment from stakeholders

•      Providing quality training

•      Industry contacts

•      Experienced management and staff

Weakness

•      New RTO

•      Not offering a range of qualifications

 

 

Opportunities

•      A new model for marketing and social media

•      Introducing new courses

•      Build a relationship across different sector

•      To provide quality training 

•      Adopt new technologies to improve the training

•      Global influences

•      Market development

Threats

•      Changes in the VET sector

•      Changes in the Australian political system

•      Increased number of RTO providers and competition

•      Failure to invest in marketing and advertising appropriately

 

 

Marketing mix

Product

Product/services offered are Diploma and Advanced Diploma of Business. The upcoming planned new course, General English-speaking course.

Place

Product/service is intended for college/university students and faculty of Melbourne. It is available face-to-face and via the Internet on any electronic device.

Price

Pricing covers significant costs related to course design, development, resources required and cash flow for future growth.

Promotion

The product/service must be promoted in current and other prospective markets through market development.

The channels will include print media, advertisements and social media platforms

Marketing promotions          

Career Training’s marketing promotions program is simplistic, out of date and not yet integrated.

The promotions are limited and predominately traditional. They don’t take into account the rise of social media and social media platforms.

Budget

The management has allocated 5% to 7% of the development budget for marketing opportunities. The development budget is $120,000 (One hundred and twenty thousand dollars)

Task:

The management has appointed you as a new marketing manager. You are required to perform the following activities:

1. Explore 4 marketing opportunities
2. Evaluate the above  4 marketing opportunities against Alignment with the organisational goals and capabilities, Impact on current business and potential competition, Cost-benefit analysis and the estimated effect on return on investment.
3. Evaluate required changes to current operations

across the vast expanse of North America over

Write an interesting, riveting and lengthy fanfic that crosses over My Hero Academia, Infinite Stratos and the anime series Guilty Crown, in which Izuku Midoriya replaces both Ichika Orimura and Shu Ouma, Mei Hatsume takes the place of both Inori Yuzuriha and Tabane Shinomono, Momo Yaoyorozu replaces Houki Shinomono, Melissa Shield takes the place of Charlotte Dunois, Ochakou Uraraka takes the place of Lingyin "Rin" Huang, Ibara Shiozaki takes the place of Cecilia Alcott, Nemuri Kayama takes the place of Chifiyu Orimura, Rumi "Miruko' Usagiyama takes the place of Maya Yamada and Nejire Hado takes the place of Katana 'Tatenashi" Sarashiki. 

The Meta Liberation Army replaces both Phantom Task from Infinite Stratos and the GHQ from Gulity Crown, with Knucleduster's vigilante organization replacing the resistance group Funeral Parlor from Guilty Crown. 
 Like Shu and Ichika, Izuku forms a harem with the girls around him, but unlike them eventually admits they love him and tries to develop a relationship with them. 

Izuku's father Hiashi is, in fact, All for One, and has his face fixed and body repaired by his loyal servant Dr. Kyudai Garaki after the MHA assassinates All Might, giving up villinary and returning to his wife and son to make up for the time he didn't spend with them. Hiashi also brings along one of his youngest daughters, the shy and reserved silver-haired middle schooler Eri, whom he rescued from the grip of the Yakuza who were after her powerful time manipulation quirk.

Hiashi passes off Eri as a street child whom he adopted to avoid questions from both his wife Inko and son Izuku. But to Hiashi's surprise, Inko takes very well to Eri, seeing her as the daughter she never had. Eri also begins to form a brotherly bond with Izuku, and slowly develops a secret crush on him which both Inko and Hiashi notice and secretly encourage, in the hopes of getting grandchildren soon. 

Meanwhile, the battle against the MLA and its control of the Hero Commission takes a new turn when the Righteous Army, an ultranationalist group inspired by the Japanese group of the same name that was behind the failed Showa Restoration of the 1930s, enters the fray and begins to help Knucleduster's organization and the remains of Stain's followers in the fight against the Quirk supremacist agenda of the Meta Liberation Army. The conflict spills out into the open and becomes a full-scale civil war, with Endeavor revealing himself as a secret MLA member and King Vlad leaving the Hero Commission and joining forces with the Righteous Army to defeat the evil of the MLA. 

Izuku learns how to master his "Power of the King" and awakens his true Quirk, a fusion of his mother's telekinesis and his father's All for One quirk. This proves useful in taking the Quirks and Voids of MLA minions and corrupt heroes, making him a key asset to the resistance

The Righteous Army and Knuckle Duster's organization win the civil war, restoring the imperial system that had been dissolved by the Allies in 1947  as the government of Japan. The newly restored Japanese empire reclaims the Korean peninsula, Sahlakin Islands, the Kurils and Taiwan through a series of political maneuverings and diplomatic overlays, and reclaims the old protectorates of Manchukou in Manchuria and Mengjiang in Inner Mongolia. China undergoes a revolution that sees the Reorganized Government of China from WW2 restored as the government of the nation, with the House of Zhu resuming its position as the Chinese imperial family. The newly restored Chinese Empire becomes a protectorate of Japan, signifying a new era for East Asia as a whole. 

The story ends with Izuku and his main harem members of Mei, Momo, Ochakou, Ibara, Nemuri, Rumi and Nejire laughing and chatting in the large mansion that the Midoriya family now call home, while Kyoka Jiro and the psuedo vampire girl Himiko Toga look on with love and affection. Kyoka and Toga joined Izuku's harem after he saved them from a corrupt hero, and love Izuku just as much as the other girls. Eri also confessed her love to Izuku and joined his harem.

 Koichi Haimawari, the vigilante known as the Crawler, observes Izuku and his harem from the safety of a nearby tree, unseen and unnoticed by the people he is observing. He comments that Izuku and the girls are going to be parents pretty soon based on the loving looks the girls are giving Izuku, and disappears, off to deal with his next job. From his position on the dinner table, Hiashi cocks an eye at Koichi leaving, shaking his head and saying "kids these days" before going back to reading his newspaper, his life of villainy finally done for a peaceful life with his family.

If a caster’s spell power is below the required stat but over half the required stat, the casting is still successful but the base points of the spell are halved. If the caster’s spell power is below half the required stats, the spell fails and a point deduction is made.

Issei remains unaware of who is really is until he is rescued from a T-800 by his biological mother in San Francisco. When Issei returns to Japan after the events of T2, he starts making preparations for the upcoming Future War and for dealing with Skynet. . The blonde-haired, blue-eyed reprogrammed TX/"Termimatrix" Unit Cameron still arrives in the present to protect John, but she is surprised to learn that he is now Issei. She moves into the Hyoudou home as their new maid, causing Issei's sisters to get jealous.

. . . . . Issei is surprised at this strange news, but quickly adjusts, helping to keep Miyu away from the prying eyes of fellow resistance members who have arrived in the present and intelligence agents looking for answers.

Suddenly, she can hear an unexpected voice on the other side of the door asking about what's happening - the voice of her aunt, who she wasn't expecting to see and would've rather avoided altogether in such a predicament (the aunt has been staying with the returning woman as of late; she’s the returning woman’s elder by approximately 20 years; give her a name and describe her appearance; she should be wearing an outfit that is adequate for napping). The aunt was apparently napping inside the flat this whole time. The aunt, after verifying the identity of the knocker, begins opening the door, but is taking too much time doing so due to being weary following her nap, as the returning woman implores her to open the door and to hurry up. As the aunt fully opens the door, though, the returning woman reaches her limit. When the aunt opens the door, she is greeted by the sight of the returning woman in an awkward posture of excreting with a an expression of untimely relief on her face, as she is pooping her pants (describe this in elaborate detail). Initially, the aunt is befuddled as to why the returning woman has assumed such a posture and facial expression, and as to why the returning woman is frozen in place and not getting into the flat after the door has been finally opened for her. The aunt asks the returning woman why she isn’t entering, but is met in response with a hand-raise gesture intended to silence, a dismissive verbal reply and soft grunts of exertion that almost sound as if they are filled with relief-induced pleasure, as the returning woman is still in the midst of relieving herself in her pants and relishing the release. The aunt attempts to inquire about the returning woman's peculiar behavior, but reaps the same result, as the returning woman hasn’t finished relieving herself in her pants and is still enjoying the relief. As she is giving the returning woman a puzzled and bemused stare, she is met with the odor that is emanating from the deposit in the returning woman’s pants, to which she reacts (describe this in elaborate detail). It then dawns on the aunt what had just happened. As this is occurring, the returning woman finishes relieving herself in her pants with a sigh of relief. With bewilderment, the aunt asks the returning woman if she just did what she thinks she did. The aunt then breaks into laughter. The returning woman initially tries to avoid explicitly admitting to what had happened and asks the aunt to let her inside the flat. However, after some teasing insistence by the aunt - who wants to hear the returning woman explicitly say what she had done - that she won't let the returning woman enter if she won't explicitly explain what had happened, and after some equivocating on the returning woman's part, the returning woman sheepishly admits that she went in her pants. It is only after this exchange that the returning woman gingerly waddles into the flat, passing by the laughing aunt as the latter is standing at the doorway. As the returning woman is entering and passing by the aunt, the aunt incredulously taunts her for having childishly pooped her pants and for her waddle with poop-filled pants (describe this in elaborate detail). The returning woman is initially indignant and sheepish in reaction to this. After the aunt continues to incredulously tease her for for the way in which she pooped her pants and for the way in which she fully finished relieving herself in her pants while at the door before entering (include these dialogues and don’t omit any parts), the returning woman gradually starts growing out of her initial mortification and playfully tells the aunt with a playful sulk that what happened is her fault because she took too much time opening the door. The returning woman then sets her sight on heading to the bathroom so she can clean up and expresses her desire to do so. However, she is subsequently stopped gently by the aunt, who wants to get a closer look at the returning woman’s poop-filled pants because of her incredulous curiousity over the absurdity of the situation of the returning woman pooping her pants at such an age. After gently and teasingly stopping the playfully resistant, reluctant and protesting but eventually cooperating woman in her tracks on her way to the bathroom, the aunt delicately turns the returning woman by the wrist so she can observe her rear end, and proceeds to incredulously taunt her for pooping her pants as an adult, comparing her accident and poop-filled pants to a dirty diaper (describe this in elaborate detail; the aunt’s taunting shouldn’t be sarcastically witty, it should be mockingly teasing instead). The returning woman responds to the aunt’s observation of her rear end in a coy and sheepish manner, relating to the aunt the nasty feeling in her poop-filled pants and playfully whining that she has to go to clean up. The aunt mockingly reacts to the odor that is emanating from the returning woman with a physical gesture and teasingly agrees with the returning woman that the returning woman needs to go and clean up because the returning woman really stinks, and the aunt does all of this while addressing the returning woman by a contextually relevant mocking appellation (describe this in elaborate detail; the aunt’s teasing shouldn’t be sarcastically witty, it should be taunting instead). The returning woman accepts the aunt’s mocking and teasing in a coy and sheepish manner, all while commenting on her own poop-filled pants and on the odor that is emanating from herself, but playfully insists ultimately this is all the aunt's doing because of the delay while opening the door (describe this in elaborate detail). Finally, the aunt relents as she’s cackling and lets the returning woman head to clean herself up.

Generate the first chapter of a long story, with the following characters, setting and themes, entirely from the elf's perspective. Write to maximum length. Go into salacious detail, and focus primarily on dialogue. Feet should be described in long and excessive detail. Appearances should be described in extra detail. Create interesting, layered personalities for the characters. Character's dialogue and ways of speaking should reflect their differing personalities. Setting: Medieval fantasy world. Vampires in this world view mortals as an inferior species, particularly due to their ticklish feet (which makes submission curses more effective and furthermore, tickling is viewed as the proper way a responsible footslave owner should punish her footslaves should they slip up). Elder vampires possess magical eyes, which allow them to see the thoughts, and weaknesess of any mortal. Vampires are impossible to distinguish from mortals, which leads them to infiltrate normal society. Usually when one realises they are dealing with a vampire, it is too late. They are reviled by the populace, but also feared. Characters: A dark and mysterious woman, really an elder vampire, of dark beauty. She is cunning, silver-tongued and disingenuous. Has a love of women's feet, particularly that of virgins. Through her knowledge of tickling, and dark powers, she plots to assemble a collection of footslaves (in this world a footslave is one devoted to their mistress' feet, as well as offering their own feet to them to be used as they wish; usually, a footslave requires a magical and eternally binding curse that only works with, even if it is under duress, the victim's consent, and a humiliating foot ritual). A proud high elf diplomat and scion, with elegant, graceful, and ultimately perfect feet; and a secret she keeps far inside herself, one she would never admit to even if cornered, or confronted: the unparalleled ticklishness of those feet. Proud and self-assured, she would never submit to a creature— well, that's what she believes. Themes: Seduction, the slow but inevitable slip into submission, the acceptance of true inferiority of being ticklish, the perverse love found in submitting to vampiric feet, and the humbling of arrogant mortals.

Delilah is a rich 20-year-old. She has pale skin, blue eyes, and long brown hair. She’s wearing a nice outfit with lots of layers.

From Delilah's perspective, write a scene in first person where she’s sitting in the front row of a chemistry class with twenty other girls. Before the professor walks in to start the class, a deluge of food appears from thin air, and absolutely saturates everyone in a rainbow of sticky desserts and sweet toppings, both thick and runny, chunky and smooth. Their hair and faces are smothered; every item of their clothing is oozing with goop both inside and out, all the pockets overflowing, waterfalls of it pouring onto the floor. The barrage starts with gloppy pies and cakes, and ends with runnier stuff like sauces and syrups. Delilah starts by getting a pair of gooey fudgecakes in the face, then a dozen pies absolutely plaster her clothes from the waist-up. And more mess continues to pour.

Delilah describes in detail what hers and everyone else's obliterated clothes look like after the mess. She and the rest of the front row got hit even harder than everyone else, and Delilah worst of all.

Use specific language. Pace the scene slowly to keep up tension. Include lots of dialogue. Make it long. Be specific about how the mess covers the girls.

Write a single-idea 5000 word essay Using Complex vocabulary and sentence structures, including varied punctuation and transition words and Tone must be in active voice, informative and authoritative and writing style is coherent, consistent, and organized and the sentences are logically structured to create a clear and progressive flow of ideas on Child narrators in adult literature in twenty first century-trends, circumstances and themes. Support with critics points and references verbatim 
Use below writing to develop your essay in the same tone and style.
The study of child narrators and focalisers has become increasingly popular in recent years. This can be observed in the growing number of publications and scholarly works that have emerged, highlighting the growing desire to comprehend and explore the unique and nuanced perspectives of young individual. One of the key reasons for this growing interest in children’s perspectives is the recognition of the unique and valuable insights that children can offer. Today, children are no longer seen as just miniature adults or predominantly innocent or naive creatures but as “knowing, manipulative, destructive, and sexual beings.” (childhood in the contemporary novel DINTER) Instead of adhering to a linear narrative of childhood as a progression from “innocence to experience, from ignorance to knowledge, and from dependency to autonomy,” contemporary research emphasises how “childhood is shaped by the power dynamics of the generational order.” (Dinter and Schneider, 36) Modern works of literature break away from the traditional ideas of childhood as simply a stage of life. Instead, they delve into the factors, motivations, and struggles that shape its cultural creation. (Dinter, Introduction, 2020) 
Novels for adults about childhood are a booming genre within the con- temporary British literary market. Since the 1980s, many established authors have published such works – among them Salman Rushdie with Midnight’s Children (1981), Jeanette Winterson with Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit (1985), Doris Lessing with The Fifth Child (1988), Kate Atkinson with Behind the Scenes at the Museum (1996), Pat Barker with Another World (1999) and Border Crossing (2001), Zadie Smith with White Teeth (2000), Ian McEwan with Atonement (2001), Kazuo Ishiguro with Never Let Me Go (2005), A. S. Byatt with The Children’s Book (2009) and Maggie O’Farrell with The Hand That First Held Mine (2009). Emerging authors, including Stephen Knight in Mr Schnitzel (2000), Toby Litt in deadkidsongs (2001), Helen Dunmore in Mourning Ruby (2003), Diana Evans in 26a (2005) and M. R. Carey in The Girl with All the Gifts (2015), have contributed to this trend. The longlists and shortlists of Britain’s most distinguished literary prizes, the Man Booker Prize and the Costa Novel Award (formerly the Whitbread Award), feature many of these works too. Other novels about childhood, such as J. G. Ballard’s Empire of the Sun (1984), P. D. James’s The Children of Men (1992), Meera Syal’s Anita and Me (1996) and Nick Hornby’s About a Boy (1998), are perhaps even better known for their film adaptations. Furthermore, childhood novels from other Anglophone countries have been immensely successful in Britain. Patrick McCabe’s The Butcher Boy (1992), Roddy Doyle’s Paddy Clarke Ha Ha Ha (1993), Lionel Shriver’s We Need to Talk about Kevin (2003), Jonathan Safran Foer’s Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close (2005), Anne Enright’s The Gath- ering (2007) and Kathleen Winter’s Annabel (2010) come to mind here. The popularity of childhood is not limited to fiction alone. ‘Misery lit’, memoirs about “challenging, often dramatic childhoods – characterized by abuse, poverty, and identity struggles” (Douglas 1), has been thriving since the early 1990s, with Dave Pelzer’s A Child Called ‘It’ (1995) and Frank McCourt’s Angela’s Ashes (1996) becoming classics.

The woman flatmate asks the returning woman why she isn't entering, but is only met with soft grunts from the returning woman who is still in the midst of relieving herself in her pants. The Shang kings prayed to Cheng Tang for a bountiful harvest and victory in war with neighboring states.
